161001.name: Code Name: S.T.E.A.M.
161001.description:
"Code Name: S.T.E.A.M. is an upcoming turn-based strategy game for the Nintendo 3DS handheld video game console. The game is developed by Intelligent Systems, and will be published by Nintendo.

The game is played as a turn-based strategy game, with elements of a third person shooter.

Unlike in Fire Emblem, another of Intelligent Systems' strategy game series, which incorporates permadeath, players can revive their characters in S.T.E.A.M. by using medals.

In addition to being developed by Intelligent Systems, Shigeru Miyamoto of Mario and The Legend of Zelda, and Hitoshi Yamagami of Xenoblade Chronicles, Fire Emblem and Pokémon, will be involved in the game's creation. The game's art style will be heavily influenced by the silver age of comic books, such as the work by Jack Kirby, as well as by the more recent comic creator Bruce Timm. The designs for the enemy alien characters are heavily influenced by the works of H. P. Lovecraft."

Source: Wikipedia, "[http://www.en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Code_Name%3A_S.T.E.A.M. Code Name: S.T.E.A.M.]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

161002.description:
Cost: 4 Rune
Value: 2 Honor
Effect: Once this turn, you may acquire a Hero in the void as though it were in the center row.
161002.name: Ascension: Forrest, Beastwarden

161003.name: Set G
161003.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Dungeons in Blue series brings classic blue maps to the virtual tabletop! These ready-to-fill maps are packed with rooms, corridors, pits, and caves; all judiciously sprinkled with tricks and traps. Every geomorph tile seamlessly connects to every other tile in the series, providing the megadungeon builder tremendous freedom and flexibility.

This product includes twelve unique map tiles rendered at 100px per five-foot square. The set includes two versions of each tile, one for players and one for GMs. The GM's version shows additional features, tricks, and traps. This set includes:

Four 100x100 foot standard tiles.
Four 50x50 foot corner tiles.
Four 50x100 foot edge tiles.
A map legend image detailing all markup used on the tiles.
A one-third scale summary map showing all tiles.
A short readme PDF.




All maps are ready-to-use PNG-format files compatible with most virtual tabletops. Use them as-is, or combine them into larger maps using your favorite image processing software.

Our map philosophy is simple: show the permanent features of the area without unnecessary clutter. Our maps aren't marked up with creatures or minor furnishings, leaving plenty of space for the GM's additions.

161009.name: Hyrule Warriors

videogamehonor.26797: 2014 Golden Geek Most Innovative Video Game Nominee

161009.description:
"Hyrule Warriors, known in Japan as Zelda Musō (Japanese: ゼルダ無双 Hepburn: Zeruda Musō?, lit. "Zelda Unrivaled"), is a hack and slash action video game released in Japan on August 14, 2014, in Europe on September 19, in Australia on September 20th, and in North America on September 26. Developed by Omega Force and Team Ninja for the Wii U video game console, the game is a collaboration between Koei Tecmo and Nintendo, and is part of both Nintendo's The Legend of Zelda series and Koei Tecmo's Dynasty Warriors series."

Source: Wikipedia, "Hyrule Warriors", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

161010.name: Desert Fox: The Battle of El Alamein
161010.description:
Decription written by developer for VGG:
History and turn-based strategy collide in Desert Fox: The Battle of El Alamein!

The award-winning team behind Battle of the Bulge and Drive on Moscow asks: Can you outwit the Desert Fox?

Take control at the turning point of the battle for North Africa in this WWII strategy game. Will you hold the line as the Commonwealth or capture the Suez Canal as the Axis?

Command a grand campaign, making key decisions and controlling the final engagement. In the oppressive heat of the desert, supplies are running low. Do you wait for more, or make a desperate attack now with tired troops? Use mines, ridges, and depressions to your advantage in desert warfare against challenging AI or online opponents. Desert Fox, designed from the ground up for iPhone and iPad, is a thrilling wargame experience for both casual and veteran players.

Key Features:
•Command tanks, recon units, flak guns and more in strategic desert warfare
•Call the shots and decide when to attack or defend in campaign mode
•Learn the ropes through quick, guided tutorials
•Face off against distinct AI opponents, local friends, or players online
•Battle through two stand-alone scenarios in addition to the grand campaign
•Relive victories with replays, leaderboards, and achievements
•Improve your strategy with full rules and charts and tables
•Discover history with extensive historical photos and commentary
•Designed by Mark Herman, award-winning inventor of Washington’s War

161011.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Alton Towers Resort, a theme park in the U.K.; it's celebrating the start-up of the rollercaster 'The Timer'.
161011.name: Monopoly: Alton Towers – The Smiler

161012.name: Bathild
161012.description:
From the blurb (translated):

Bathild is a Green-Zone town about 250 km North of Berlin: it has a population of 2.500 and has been fortified to keep the undead outside.

161013.name: Theatrhythm Final Fantasy Curtain Call

videogamehonor.31972: 2014 Game Critics Best Handheld Game of the Year Nominee

161013.description:
"THEATRHYTHM FINAL FANTASY CURTAIN CALL™ expands on the original in every way with new gameplay modes, over 200 songs, and 60 playable characters. Featuring music that spans the full breadth of the FINAL FANTASY franchise, players tap along to the beats and harmonies as the adorable characters battle and quest through their worlds. The music of over 20 titles is brought together in one package, fusing together the moving scores, cinematic visuals, and role-playing elements the series is known for.


New content takes center stage: Includes songs and characters from recent releases including LIGHTNING RETURNS: FINAL FANTASY XIII and FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn, to classic fan favorites such as FINAL FANTASY TACTICS and FINAL FANTASY VII: Advent Children.



More ways to play: New gameplay modes include Versus Mode where players can go head-to-head in screen-tapping action, as well as Quest Medley, where players customize a party of their favorite characters to take across fields and into dungeons for music-based battles.



Unlock FINAL FANTASY: Gather Rhythmia to unlock new characters, songs, and collectible cards, which can be used in the all new Collecta Crystarium to power up your characters’ stats."


Source: The Publisher Website.

161014.name: Sine Requie: Bergamo
161014.description:
From the blurb (translated):

Bergamo is a Sanctum Imperium town that lies in the Alps: the walled High town counts 6.000 inhabitants; one thousand more live in the dangerous villages outside the town.

161015.name: Splatoon

videogamehonor.31982: 2014 Game Critics Best Online Multiplayer of the Year Nominee

161015.description:
User summary

An online "team vs team" third-person shooter with a twist.

In each match, 8 players are randomly divided into 2 teams. The goal of the match is, however, not to shoot the enemy, but to paint the floor in your team's colour. The team who has painted more floor when the match ends (after 3 minutes) wins.

Players are equipped with either one of many kinds of guns that fire paint, or a roller, or a paint brush or a bucket or any other kind of paint-spreading thing. The player characters are a sort of semi-human semi-squid (called "inklings"), and can switch to squid shape at the press of a button. As a squid you can't fire, but you can swim in your own colour becoming almost inivisible, you move in double speed and also reload your ink tank (ammo). If you paint walls, you can swim up on walls in this manner; though painting walls won't count towards victory. Moving in your enemy's colour makes you slower and will do slight damage.

Getting hit by the enemy repeated times will cause you do splat into the enemy's colour, and you'll have a several seconds wait until your respawn at your team's starting point. It's possible to send yourself flying to a team-mate's location.

Together with the typical twin-stick FPS control scheme, the Gamepad's gyro is used to complement the right stick's control in which direction the player is looking; a system that is very effective for precise aiming.

The game also has a 2-player mode where two players run around on a stage trying to shoot balloons, and a single player mode where the player needs to clear stages of enemies and find secrets.

161016.name: Incubo dal profondo
161016.description:
From the blurb (translated):

Strange happenings on an oil platform in the North Sea arouse suspicions in the minister of industry, who sends a representative to investigate before production stops altogether.

161017.name: Super Mario Maker

videogamehonor.31638: 2014 Game Critics Best Social/Casual/Puzzle Game of the Year Winner

161017.description:
"Mario Maker is a side-scroller platform game creating application developed and published by Nintendo for the Wii U video game console, scheduled for release in 2015. The application is a spin-off of the Mario series, in which players can create their own Mario levels.

Players can easily switch between two different visual styles: the original Super Mario Bros. 8-bit NES graphics, and the New Super Mario Bros. U style of HD graphics."

Source: Wikipedia, "Mario Maker", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

161018.name: Captain Toad: Treasure Tracker

videogamehonor.32512: 2015 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Design of the Year Nominee

161018.description:
User summary:

A puzzle-oriented platform game. The player controls Kinopio ("Toad"), who must walk around on a small 3D stage in search of a power star. The stages are small and fully rotatable, viewable from any angle.

This was originally a mini game in Super Mario 3D World for the WiiU. The game in question is merely a collection of 70+ stages of this type, bound together by a story that essentially is just there for the show. Some bonus stages are unlocked if the game finds a save data for Super Mario 3D world.

The power star on each stage is typically clearly visible, but Kinopio can't jump, so the major challenge to figure out how to reach the power star. Each stage also contains 3 hidden diamonds; these play the role of the power stars in Mario 64, in that that certain stages requires a certain number of diamonds in order to be unlocked. Each stage also contains a special "achievement", the requirements of which are revealed the first time the stage is cleared ("Clear the stage without taking damage", "Collect 70 coins", "Find the hidden mushroom"). Completing this achievement and taking the three diamonds causes the stage to get a "done" stamp, and when all stages in a batch (typically 18 stages in a batch) are "done", each stage in the batch can be time-challenged.

161019.name: Mario Party 10
161019.description:
"Mario Party 10 (Japanese: マリオパーティ10 Hepburn: Mario Pāti Ten) is an upcoming party video game developed and published by Nintendo for Wii U. It is the tenth main game in the Mario Party series, the fourteenth overall, and the first game in the series for Wii U.

Mario Party 10 continues the tradition of the Mario Party series, in which four players, controlled by either human or CPU, compete against each other on a game board by participating in various minigames. At least one board will feature the same play style introduced in Mario Party 9, in which all four players travel across the board together. Along with the standard competitive modes, Mario Party 10 introduces a new mode called Bowser Party, in which a fifth player controls Bowser using the Wii U GamePad. In this mode, the four main players are tasked with reaching the end of the board without losing all of their hearts whilst avoiding being caught by Bowser, who is trying to stop them. If Bowser catches up to the other players, a minigame takes place in which Bowser uses the GamePad's features to activate various devices, such as tilt controlled fire rods, pinball flippers, and a spinning wheel, whilst the other players attempt to take as little damage as possible. The players win if at least one player makes it to the end of the board with their hearts intact, but if all players are defeated, Bowser wins."

Source: Wikipedia, "Mario Party 10", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

161020.name: Johan's Lost Vault
161020.description:
From publisher blurb:

At one time the City of Tygos was a bustling metropolis located in the southeastern portion of the Plains of Dorack. Sitting in the shadow of the Dorack Mountains this city flourished as a trading metropolis. Decades ago the leaders of the city, the Serpentine Cultists, began a racially charged campaign against certain factions of the Plainsmen tribes. The resulting response of the Plainsmen was devastating to Tygos and the city was levelled for the most part and the water supply was poisoned. The city was also home to a group of adventurers called JOHAN and their fortress was said to contain powerful ancient magic that was never recovered. If these items can be located the resulting power can bring continued success to your party’s wealth and fame.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a mid to high level group of adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

161021.name: Gauntlet (2014)
161021.description:
User Summary

Gauntlet is a remake of the original and contains the Warrior, Valkyrie, Wizard and Elf. With up to four player you enter a dungeons to slay hundreds of undead and other monsters. Focus is on quantity, not quality of the opponents. A real 'Hack & Slash'. Gameplay is easy to get into, with three out of four characters only having a normal attack, 2 special moves and one "extra special" attack which has a cool down time. Only the wizard is different, employing 9 different spells.

161022.name: Mobster Archetypes

rpgseries.24608: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters

161022.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: Mobster Archetypes

Mobster Archetypes gives you 17 mobster characters built using the Archetypes provided in Savage Worlds Deluxe! Need a nimble driver to make the fast getaway? No problem! Would a Tommy gun-toting marksman make your day? We've got you covered! Would a sledgehammer-wielding mook give your players a pain? Done and done!

161023.name: Hired Guns Archetypes

rpgseries.24608: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters

From publisher blurb:

About Cast of Cards: Hired Guns Archetypes

Hired Guns Archetypes provides agents and freelancers that you might need for modern-era gameplay. These NPCs tote everything from .45 pistols to assault rifles to laptop computers and can be used as Extras, allies or enemies in your gaming group.

161024.name: Wewelsburg Contingent

rpgseries.24608: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters

161024.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" About Cast of Cards: Wewelsburg Contingent

Wewelsburg Castle was a mysterious base for the SS during World War II. The Nazis were known to conduct strange experiments there, the true extent of which is unknown. Cast of Cards: Wewelsburg Contingent takes your players into that castle and populates it with men and monsters from the Third Reich!

161025.name: Set M
161025.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Dungeons in Blue series brings classic blue maps to the virtual tabletop! These ready-to-fill maps are packed with rooms, corridors, pits, and caves; all judiciously sprinkled with tricks and traps. Every geomorph tile seamlessly connects to every other tile in the series, providing the megadungeon builder tremendous freedom and flexibility.

This product includes twelve unique map tiles rendered at 100px per five-foot square. The set includes two versions of each tile, one for players and one for GMs. The GM's version shows additional features, tricks, and traps. This set includes:

Six 100x100 foot tiles in a variety of configurations.
Six 100x50 foot tiles in a variety of configurations.
A map legend image detailing all markup used on the tiles.
A one-third scale summary map showing all tiles.
A short readme PDF.




(*) Tiles in Set M, Set N, and Set O introduce cross-tile water features. Water-feature edges tile seamlessly with similar water-features edges, but will not match up with non-water-feature edges.

All maps are ready-to-use PNG-format files compatible with most virtual tabletops. Use them as-is, or combine them into larger maps using your favorite image processing software.

Our map philosophy is simple: show the permanent features of the area without unnecessary clutter. Our maps aren't marked up with creatures or minor furnishings, leaving plenty of space for the GM's additions.

Our map philosophy is simple: show the permanent features of the area without unnecessary clutter. Our maps aren't marked up with creatures or minor furnishings, leaving plenty of space for the GM's additions.

161031.description:
To be granted command of a VT-49 Decimator is seen as a significant promotion for a middling officer of the Imperial Navy. A heavily armed transport, the VT-49 Decimator is one of the Empire’s most feared warships, often used to provide long-range reconnaissance or to deploy raiding parties past enemy forces.

The VT-49 Decimator Expansion Pack brings this intimidating Imperial gunboat to X-Wing as the game’s largest ship yet designed for Standard Play. Even at the game’s signature 1/270 scale, the expansion pack’s detailed miniature towers over its base and smaller starfighters.

In addition to its imposing, pre-painted miniature, the VT-49 Decimator Expansion Pack introduces four ship cards, three debris cloud tokens, a new mission, a maneuver dial, and all the tokens you need to fly your Decimator into the thick of combat. Finally, you’ll find thirteen upgrade cards, which introduce a variety of crew members like Mara Jade and Fleet Officer designed to help you fill out the Decimator’s three crew member slots.
161031.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – VT-49 Decimator Expansion Pack

161032.description:
A fast and resilient light freighter, the YT-2400 features no fewer than thirteen weapon emplacement points, making it an attractive vessel for smugglers, mercenaries, and other individuals looking for a heavily armed “transport.” Although a stock YT-2400 light freighter has plenty of space for cargo, much of that space is often annexed to support modified weapon systems and oversized engines.

The YT-2400 Freighter Expansion Pack brings this formidable light freighter to your table as a Rebel starship with two attack, two agility, five hull, and five shields.

The highlight of the YT-2400 Freighter Expansion Pack is its detailed miniature starship, which is enhanced by one new mission, three debris cloud tokens, a maneuver dial, all requisite tokens, and four ship cards, including one for the famed smuggler Dash Rendar.

Of course, a ship as readily customizable as the YT-2400 needs to come with a host of upgrade options, and the YT-2400 Freighter Expansion Pack comes with thirteen upgrade cards, including a Lando Calrissian crew upgrade, the Outrider Title, and upgrade cards designed by each of the game’s first two World Champions.
161032.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – YT-2400 Freighter Expansion Pack

161033.name: Mythic Babau and Hezrou
161033.description:
From publisher blurb:

Poisonous Fiends from the Heart of the Abyss!

All demons are noxious, repugnant, and vile, but two stand out as perhaps the most disgusting and toxic of them all: the slime-drenched babau and the oily, stinking hezrou. The lean, quick babau are the assassins of the underworld, born of serial murderers, and so inherently wretched that their skin constantly weeps an acidic ichor that covers their entire body. The hulking hezrou, by comparison, is a powerful abyssal heavyweight that corrupts and warps everything it touches, and pollutes the very world around it. Many fear and revile these loathsome creatures, and rightfully so, but they are nothing when compared to the mythic paragons of their species.

This book presents game statistics for mythic babau and mythic hezrou, both of which have unique abilities never seen elsewhere. Mythic babau are expert assassins who not only excel at making powerful, deadly sneak attacks, even when others would not be able to, but also are invigorated by making a bloody kill, and gain the ability to spit blobs of clinging acid at their foes from afar. Mythic hezrou, by contrast, can cause bodies to twist, warp, and putrefy with a single touch, can surround themselves with a deadly miasma of toxic gases to punish those who would dare approach them, and can even corrupt entire landscapes in a 10-mile radius with their mere presence. In addition to these game statistics, the book also introduces rules for performing special rituals that can be enacted by players of any class in order to summon mythic babau and mythic hezrou, with both specific game rules for doing so and detailed flavorful descriptions.

161034.name: Small Dungeons #01
161034.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need a stand-alone map for your virtual tabletop game? Small Dungeons add self-contained maps to the Dungeons in Blue collection! Each Small Dungeons product contains a stand-alone, ready-to-fill dungeon map drawn in the classic-blue style. Each includes assorted tricks, traps, and features, but leaves plenty of room for the GM's additions. All Small Dungeons also include geomorph-ready versions of the GM and player maps, with the added doors, rooms, and corridors required to connect to other Dungeons in Blue tiles.

Small Dungeons #1 includes:

Player and GM versions of a 100x200-foot stand-alone dungeon map.
Player and GM versions of the map with geomorph-ready additions.
A map legend image detailing all map markup.
A one-third scale summary map showing both versions of the player's map.
A short readme PDF.




All maps are ready-to-use PNG-format files (100px per five-foot square) compatible with most virtual tabletops. Use them as-is, or combine them into larger maps using your favorite image processing software.

161043.name: Icon Pack One
161043.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every good GM wants to customize their maps. Icon Packs provide dozens of unique features and objects ready to drop into your geomorph dungeon!

The Dungeons in Blue series brings classic blue maps to the virtual tabletop! These ready-to-fill maps are packed with rooms, corridors, pits, and caves; all judiciously sprinkled with tricks and traps. Every geomorph tile seamlessly connects to every other tile in the series, providing the megadungeon builder tremendous freedom and flexibility.

This product contains over 75 map icons designed for use with Dungeons in Blue geomorph tiles and your favorite virtual tabletop software. Icons are drawn using the same style and scale (100px per five foot square) as the original maps, allowing you to quickly and easily customize your map. The icons in this pack include:

Trees, altars, statues, and pillars
Boulders, individual and arranged in piles and markers
Slime patches and stalagmites
Grates, curtains, and cages
Pits, wells, stairs, and pools
Normal, trap, and false doors
Wall and floor tiles to cover unwanted features




This product also includes a copy of the latest map key. Note that some icon sequences may appear incomplete. Icon types are numbered sequentially across all Dungeons in Blue icon packs. Missing icons are in another icon pack.

161047.name: Kirby and the Rainbow Curse

videogamehonor.33956: 2015 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Design of the Year Nominee

161047.description:
"Kirby and the Rainbow Curse is a video game in the Kirby series currently in development by HAL Laboratory for Wii U. The game is a follow up to the 2005 Nintendo DS title, Kirby: Canvas Curse.

Kirby and the Rainbow Curse carries on the style of gameplay from Canvas Curse, presenting the game with a unique modelling clay look. Players use the Wii U GamePad to help Kirby, who is stuck in a ball form, move across the level by drawing rainbow colored lines on the touchscreen to guide him. Making Kirby go through loops will speed him up, whilst touching him will put him into a spinning attack to use against enemies. Kirby can gain various forms throughout the game, such as a submarine, a rocket, and a tank."

Source: Wikipedia, "Kirby and the Rainbow Curse", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

All maps are ready-to-use PNG-format files compatible with most virtual tabletops. Use them as-is, or combine them into larger maps using your favorite image processing software.

161057.description:
A promo card for Lost Legacy. It's a card with investigation value 8, which can win you the game if it's in your hand at the end of the game and someone investigates it.

Handed out at the June 2014 Tokyo Game Market.
161057.name: Lost Legacy: Princess (promo)

161059.name: Fossil Fighters: Frontier
161059.description:
"The latest game in the Fossil Fighters series delivers a first: Players can now hop into their vehicles and drive around exotic locations to excavate fossils, which transform into real-life dinosaurs known as Vivosaurs. Players battle their Vivosaur with wild Vivosaurs they encounter on digging adventures.

FEATURES:

While driving, set off radar blasts to help discover dinosaur fossils. Different buggies possess different features. A racing buggy, for example, goes fast and allows players to reach faraway places, while a carrier buggy is great for transporting more items.
Unearth ancient dinosaur fossils that come to life and transform into Vivosaurs. Clean fossils using tools like hammers and drills on the Nintendo 3DS* touch screen, but don’t be hasty: Carefully cleaning fossils makes the transformed Vivosaur more effective when it comes time to battle.
Using local online play, players can explore and excavate the dig sites as a three-player team.
Bring the Vivosaur you are training to join six-player local and online Vivosaur battles**, fighting three-on-three in a stadium."




Source: The Publisher Website.

161060.name: Devil's Third
161060.description:
"Devil's Third is an upcoming third-person shooter hack and slash video game by Tomonobu Itagaki's Valhalla Game Studios developed exclusively for Wii U.

The game is a third-person shooter, combined with melee fighting gameplay, featuring online play and a level editor.

The game's backstory is based on the Kessler syndrome theory. Debris from artificial satellites in orbit has created a cascading effect of collisions, leading to the destruction of nearly all satellites, both civilian and military. In the resulting turmoil, war erupts around the world as the balance of military power is thrown into chaos. Infantry battle is altered in a world without satellite technology. It can be seen from concept art that the game will be taking place around the world with Asian, European and American locations."

Source: Wikipedia, "Devil's Third", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

161062.name: Deniable Asset
161062.description:
From the back of the book:

Who were you? It's strange, but it's times like these, when it matters least, that these thoughts creep in. 'What does matter now?' It matters WHAT you are - an infiltrator, investigator, technician, and when the situation calls for it... a blunt instrument. You are a weapon. You are a tool. You are an AGENT.

Deniable Asset is a role-playing game that allows you to experience the world of espionage with a clean slate. Finding out who your character was, what they are going to be, and how they are going to accomplish the mission all happens during play. The game features rules for:

Agent creation and development - Espionage Points - Trademark Items - Cinematic Chase Scenes - Missions - Items, Gadgets, and Gear - Support Teams - Transitions - Inner Party Conflict - Perks and Flaws

161063.name: Stipulations
161063.description:
Let your negativity shine in this hilarious party game! Your imagination and creativity are the only limits on how you can ruin friends' newly announced superpowers, careers, lifetime supplies, and dreams. Your friend got a job as a model? You can add "of adult diapers." Another friend has extreme luck? Stipulate her with "at finding dead cats." Earn points for coming up with the best and funniest stipulations to beat your friends in the game while stifling their superpowers, crushing their careers, limiting their lifetime supplies, and destroying their dreams.

Stipulations begins when a player draws a Stipulations card as well as a bonus card and chooses to announce the superpower, occupation, lifetime supply, or fulfilled dream. As soon as the announcement is made, each of the other players has 90 seconds to think up and write down a stipulation, or any condition that makes the announcement worse. For example, if a player announces that they have wings, one player might write "but can't fly", whereas another player might write "with a 50 foot wingspan that can never be retracted." All players hand their written stipulations to the player sitting next to the announcer who reads them aloud. The announcer selects which of the written stipulations is the worst (whichever they would want the least) and the player who wrote it collects the stipulations card to keep track of score. The announcer also reveals the bonus point category (Funniest, Most original, etc.) and awards the bonus card to whomever they deem worthy of it based on the written stipulations. The round is then complete and the next player begins as the announcer by drawing a card.

The game is complete when all players have been the announcer twice. Players should count the Stipulation and Bonus cards that they have earned through game play. The player with the most cards is the winner.

161064.description: Duel of the Magi is a deck-building game that combines fantasy board games, drafting, and TCG fighting mechanics for a complete and unique experience. Players start by choosing one of the four magi classes, each of which have a unique ability to be used during the game. While taking turns players choose sets of spells to include or exclude in the game. Once this phase is complete, the chosen cards of each spell type are then shuffled together and placed on the board in the appropriately labeled spots. Staged face-up, the cards are drafted one at a time from the board as each player builds their own customized deck of spells. Once deck building is complete, the game board is flipped over to the dueling ground side and players engage in a spell casting fight to determine the winner. Part of the dueling strategy is gamesmanship in the form of alliances and negotiations. Do what you must to ensure you survive to the end.
161064.name: Duel of the Magi

161065.name: Rise of the Drow: VTT Maps
161065.description:
Publisher Blurb

This download contains 36 High Resolution maps for running the Rise of the Drow trilogy on a virtual tabletop. Grids have been cleared to make the maps easier to use in a VTT program and things such as secret doors have been removed to hide them from the players.

These Virtual Tabletop (VTT) maps are designed for use with VTT programs such as Roll20, d20pro, Fantasy Grounds, and others.

All maps designed and constructed by 3x ENnie Award winning cartographer Todd Gamble with help from Jonathan G. Nelson.

161066.name: Ef-One
161066.description:
Over 40,000 sold. Published in Shanghai, in Chinese, with English names and slogans as an added-on educational element.

Car racing game using cards. Three different games using the same cards: a two player card 'duel', lasting 10-30 minutes; a 2-10 player moving-around-the-track game for younger players; and a combo of the two, a 2-10 player moving-around-the-track game using the cards to interact with the others.

Backs of the cards represent a straight section of track. Fronts: left and right wide and left and right tight curves, an S-curve, a finish line, a dry/wet tire card, a sun/rain weather card, a thick perforated card with 5 two-sided cars, and 45 playing cards, in 26 types and 4 different colours representing maneuvers, special ations and anti-card actions. Also included is a handy 14-page full-colour fold-out booklet with all the rules, illustrated examples and a list of the game components.

On the accompanying website (now defunct) the games could be played substituting pictured cards for the real ones.

161067.name: Sienikkäät
161067.description:
User summary:
Sienikkäät is the adventure Munchrooms from Trollpak (2.ed) translated into finnish and published as a separate book. The adventure includes three different viewpoints to handle the adventure.

Translated from back of the book:
TROLLKIN ARE REVOLTING!!

In the Boorbar farms on the borderland of Sartar and Prax has erupted a trollkin revolt. All true trolls are dead and trollkin control the place. An expedition is gathering to crunch the trollkin. You can choose the side on which you fight: help the repressed trollkin or join to return the order with the dark trolls of Gudrun clan.

Sienikkäät is Runequest adventure for low or middle level players characters.

boardgamecompilation.161069: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Decks: On the Doorstep

161068.description:
From publisher website:
Game Night Kits for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game contain promotional material for up to four players and are designed to encourage play and build communities. Each kit includes new sets of cards, called Nightmare Decks, that enhance existing scenarios and challenge players in new ways. Prizes are also included to reward players for succeeding. As players set forth from the Shire, fight spiders, and confront Smaug, they will have to overcome all-new threats and evil tricks in the newest Nightmare Decks.

Nightmare Decks invite players to experience past adventures in an entirely new way, facing new challenges along the way. By removing certain cards from a pre-existing Encounter deck and replacing them with the cards in the Nightmare Deck, players can experience an entirely new version of the quest, taking their adventures into new realms of nightmare!
161068.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Game Night Kit 2014 Fall Season

77423.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game

boardgamecompilation.161068: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Game Night Kit 2014 Fall Season

161069.description:
Nightmare Decks for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game allow players to revisit their favorite scenarios cast in the shadows of the game's challenging Nightmare Mode. Featuring deadlier enemies, darker locations, and more terrifying surprises, each Nightmare Deck introduces new, alternate encounter cards and instructions for using them to reshape a scenario's encounter deck. The result? A nightmarish journey through territory players thought they knew, but with new twists and turns that will have them on the edges of their seats!

On the Doorstep Nightmare Decks is a single set of three twenty-card Nightmare Decks, one for each of the three scenarios from On the Doorstep, a saga expansion for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game.
161069.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Decks: On the Doorstep

77423.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game

161070.name: //N.P.P.D. RUSH//: The milk of Ultra violet
161070.description:
An open world bullethell/action rpg, where you have to prevent the city getting plunged into a drug fueled "noxious abyss". By rescuing the females that are dying at the hands of the designer drug "NOX". Along the way you must interact with the various shop to upgrade your police super bike, hack its timing circuits and even sell unused organs to an organ trafficker for extra money. All this as you slowly make you way to the confrontation with "Ultra violet", the enigmatic nightclub owner said to be behind the drug. A battle that will reveal the very nature of your existence.

Source: The Game Website.

161071.name: Goo Goo Pon
161071.description:
You are a bear, and the goal of every bear to eat a balanced diet. You've collected some food, but now you need to protect it from the other hungry bears.

The game is played in as many rounds as there are players. Each player is the "parent" bear for one round, during which the other players try to steal food tokens from the parent's table using one of four food cards. The parent can defend one type of food each round, and if the other bears get too greedy, none of them will steal anything.

rpgitemversion.281108: Parsantium: City at the Crossroads Softcover version

161072.name: Parsantium: City at the Crossroads
161072.description:
From the introduction:
Parsantium: City at the Crossroads is a sourcebook for use with all editions of the world’s most popular fantasy roleplaying games. Parsantium is a melting pot, a cosmopolitan place where trade routes meet and where great cultures collide. Inspired by Byzantium with its rich Greco-Roman heritage, it also incorporates characters, monsters and magic from the Tales of the Arabian Nights, ancient India and the Far East, alongside more traditional European fantasy elements. In Parsantium you’ll find evil cults, scheming politicians and nobles, rakshasas and serpentfolk, ancient dungeons beneath the city streets, and powerful criminal gangs, not to mention gladiators and chariot racing. In fact, Parsantium (and this book) contain enough adventure hooks, patrons and adversaries to keep most adventuring parties busy throughout their careers without ever having to venture outside the city walls.

This sourcebook is intended to be edition-neutral, notwithstanding the Pathfinder compatibility logo on the cover. There are very few stats in the book and those that do exist are intended to give an idea of the relative difference in power levels between, say, Sergeant Saurish of the City Watch (LG male human fighter 4) and Tapasranjan, Grand Master of the Esoteric Order of the Blue Lotus (LG male vanara sorcerer 19). It should be easy for the GM to change the levels of the NPCs to match a chosen game system or PC party strength.

161073.name: Space Run
161073.description:
Space Run is a PC game that mixes strategy and space ship construction in real time, borrowing certain mechanics from the “tower defense” system with numerous twists and hyper dynamic gameplay. Space Run is a nod to ‘80s science fiction and pays homage to many of its tropes and references.

The year is 2525. You are Captain Buck Mann, a Space Runner whose job is to transport valuable cargo from one end of the galaxy to the other... and one thing’s for sure: it’s going to be a bumpy ride! Not only do the cosmic highways regularly pass through asteroid belts of all sizes, but they are also used by dangerous and unscrupulous pirates armed to the teeth, whose fighters and battle cruisers will make short work of your transport vessel if you’re totally unprepared.
Fulfil your contracts with gusto and your reputation will soar, opening the doors to new clients and more demanding and hazardous assignments... but which will also be more lucrative! Unlock new modules for your ship or upgrade those you already own: laser turrets, missile launchers, shield generators, thrusters, power plants and other modules will allow you to adapt to new combat situations in mid-flight that arise on your travels. Build, recycle, repair and reposition the modules and improvise as best you can to deal with the multiple threats you will face.

Retry the first missions with the advanced modules you’ve just unlocked to improve your score, and challenge your friends to do better!
From the Publisher / Developer Website

161074.name: Mare Balticum: The Fate of an Empire
161074.description:
Mare Balticum - the Board Game© is a board game about production, trade and war around the Baltic Sea. The players take on the roles of noble lines during the Swedish Empire Era. Together, they will populate the kingdom, build ships for overseas trade, build armies for overseas war and build forts for defending the gains. Instead of fighting each other, they will have to fight the enemies around the Baltic Sea, competing for the same provinces. However, the best for the kingdom is not necessarily the best for your noble line. You have to decide what benefits you most: production or trade, consolidation or expansion, war or peace. But will your objectives coincide with your opponents' objectives? Beware, if you fight internally, your external enemies will conquer the entire kingdom and put an end to both the Swedish Empire Era and the game!

Game mechanisms include

1. Player balance: The players have a limited number of units, preventing one from growing too strong.
2. Game balance: The rate that the enemies grow is related both to the number of players and to their current strength, preventing them from getting too strong or too weak.
3. Production vs Trade vs War balance: The players may choose different strategies for growing and one strategy chosen will bring negative effects to the other strategies.
4. Cooperation: The players build fleets, armies and forts together and they also fight battles together.
5. Prisoners' dilemma. One player may benefit by not cooperating but if all do so, all will lose.

161075.description:
In Cults of Arkham you control a gang of deranged cultists trying to summon their Lovecraftian god of choice and thus end the world.
You use action dice to visit different places in Arkham, activate location abilities, and initiate fights with the other players. Your aim is to fulfil sinister plots, defeat the feared investigators, and/or control key locations in order to gain Victory Points. The first player to reach 12 Victory Points wins the game and gets to end the world his way.

The core of the game is the custom action dice you use to move your cultists and to do stuff in Arkham; learn spells, corrupt the citizens, and more. And the farther you get into the game, and the madder your cultists get, the less chance you have of the dice actually showing the results you need. Madness may be a stepping stone, but it’s also an obstacle you somehow have to manage if you want to be the best cult in Arkham.
161075.name: Cults of Arkham

161076.name: Time Vandals
161076.description:
Take control of skaters across the ages as they compete to be the first to place their tags on various points in history.

Players take turns moving one space across the board, taking any actions they move across in the process. Tags require paint cards to complete, match the cards you pick up to the ones shown on the tags then move past a painting spot to leave your mark and gain points. Create longer tags for more points, use special abilities to alter the cards in your hand or position yourself to block off other players routes.

The game ends when all paint spots are taken, then the player with the most points wins.

161077.name: Hyperdimension Neptunia PP: Producing Perfection
161077.description:
Behold Gamindustri, a world that remains peaceful thanks to the power of the Console Patron Units. Suddenly!!! Something appears and shakes the very foundation of this world! The world has been taken over by an idol boom. This growing interest in pop stars has caused the source of the CPUs’ power—shares—to vanish. Unable ignore the situation any longer the CPUs call for an emergency meeting
Source: The Publisher Website.

161082.name: Attack Squadron: Roswell
161082.description:
From the Zozer Games website:

A setting book for the Traveller roleplaying game, which requires the Traveller main book in order to play. Attack Squadron: Roswell lets players fly classic fighters such as the F-86 Sabre or the F-84 Thunderjet in combat with alien saucers, it also supports on-the-ground investigations of alien conspiracy. It is The Invaders meets X-COM meets Top Gun!

The game features:

14 aircraft designs from the 1950s
Rules for air-to-air combat
Rules for ground attack missions
1950s firearms
A history of the alien invasion
4 flying saucer designs, with two deckplans
Rules for creating fighter pilots
Background for New Mexico, Roswell and the USAF
Historically relevant event tables

161083.description: A children's game where you spin a wheel and choose a monster. Each monster has one of five colours in his tummy. You are trying to collect one of each colour as a healthy fruit, while avoiding junk foods, called "oh no's".
161083.name: Yummy Scrummy, What's in my tummy?

161085.description:
Alternate Art, Full-Bleed versioon of "Valar Morghulis" Plot Card

Text:

Limit 1 per plot deck. When revealed, kill all characters in play.

boardgameaccessory.39953: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game

161085.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – "Valar Morghulis" Alternate Art  Promo

161087.description:
Alternate Art, Full-Bleed Promo of the "Wildfire Assault" Plot Card.

Text:

When revealed, each player chooses up to 3 of his or her characters. All characters not chosen are killed (cannot be saved).

boardgameaccessory.39953: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game

161087.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – "Wildfire Assault" Alternate Art Promo

161088.description:
A Full-Bleed, Alternate Art Version of "The Power of Blood" Plot Card.

Text:

You may have up to 2 copies of The Power of Blood in your plot deck. (Noble) characters cannot be killed.

boardgameaccessory.39953: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game

161088.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – "The Power of Blood" Alternate Art Promo

161089.description:
An Alternate Art, Full-Bleed Version of "Ser Davos Seaworth" Character Card.

Text:

Smuggler, Captain Renown. Melee. Knelt Smuggler characters you control count their STR toward dominance.

boardgameaccessory.130500: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – The Great Fleet

161089.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – "Ser Davos Seaworth" Alternate Art Promo

161090.name: Meerkats
161090.description:
2, 3 or 4 players

Materials

A hexagonal board with 5 hexagons per side, 64 stones in four colors, 16 red, 16 yellow, 16 green and 16 blue.

You will also need a small drawstring bag.

Definitions

Group – A set of like color connected stones, a single stone is also considered a group.

Rules

The board is placed between the players and starts out empty.

Place 4 stones 1 each of the 4 colors (red,green,blue,yellow) in a bag and then the youngest player draws a stone and passes the bag to the next player.

After all the stones are drawn players look at their stones without revealing them to the other players.

All stones will remain hidden until the end of the game.

The color of drawn stones corresponds to the color of the stones that belong to that player.

The remaining 60 stones are placed nearby.

The youngest player starts by dropping a stone of any color onto an empty hexagon, then turn moves clockwise.

From now on, each player on his turn must drop 1 stone of any color onto an empty hexagon and then move a different stone already on the board to another empty hexagon.

Restrictions

• A stone may not be dropped onto a cell that has no adjacent empty cell.
• A stone is moved in a straight line either orthogonally until another stone in its path or the edge of the board blocks it.
• Stones cannot jump over other stones.

The game ends when a player is unable to take his turn.

Players then reveal their hidden stones, the player with the largest group in her color wins.

If two or more players are tied when comparing their largest groups then look at their second largest groups as a tie-breaker.

When playing a 2 or 3 player game the rules are the same as above with but one exception, leave the undrawn stones in the bag.

161092.name: Red Dog: Superior Firepower
161092.description: Destruction and fun go hand in hand in RED DOG: Superior Firepower, as it's up to you to save the Earth from the destructive Haak invaders. You'll have to climb into your dune-buggy-like Red Dog tank and blast the pesky aliens into oblivion, all the while avoiding incoming fire, lava flows, icy rivers, and more. You control your armored vehicle by steering and aiming with the analog stick, while braking and accelerating with the left and right triggers. A quick tap of the A button fires your main cannon and repeated taps send forth a flurry of missiles. Make sure and seek out helpful drones as you battle and add their guns, rockets, and electrical attacks to your arsenal. You can compete in challenging single-player contests and unlock armor, weapons, and maps that can be used in your two- to four-person Multiplayer competitions. Go head-to-head in fast action modes like Knockout, Suicide Bomb Tag, Stealth Assassin, and everyone's favorite King of the Hill. If you're looking for a simple evening of explosive, glide-and-gun mayhem against evil aliens or a few of your friends, then RED DOG: Superior Firepower is made just for you. -Back of the case

161093.name: Steep Slope Sliders

videogameversion.243634: North American Sega Saturn CD-ROM release

161093.description:
Steep Slope Sliders a game that was made for the Sega Saturn and Sega Titan ST-V arcade system, published in 1997. It was developed by a collaboration of Victor Interactive Software, and the Cave Company and was published by Sega.

There are four different riders, seven different tracks, and twelve audio tracks available to begin with. Players were able to unlock up to 11 extra boarders (including an Alien, UFO and Penguin), plus some hidden tracks. For its time, Steep Slope Sliders had impressive graphics and fast game play.

Source: Wikipedia, "Steep Slope Sliders", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

161095.description: A set of 25 wooden cubes with letters to replace the colored cubes from the base game. With these, the goal of the game changes; players should now align the cubes to make a 5 letter word.
161095.name: X-Plus: extension lettres

161096.name: Tavaratalopeli
161096.description: This is old and pretty simple roll and move boardgame, where you are a customer in a department store. In Finnish Tavaratalo means department store. There is three departments in the store, Paper department, food department and hous hold department. Players start from the lobby and throw the die to decide in which department they are going. After that you just roll and move throught chosen department. All the spaces in the departments sell one special thing and you just buy it. If you roll five or six, you take a random card and you either get money, or things or loose money. When you come back to Lobby you sell all the things you bought with random prize (from zero to two and half times the buying prize) decided by the dice. Game ends after certain amount of rounds and the player with most money wins.

161097.name: La licantropia in Sine Requie
161097.description:
From the blurb (translated):

There are between 200 and 250 werewolves scattered throughout Europe and Northern America: they don’t make up an united society but mainly hunt in the wilderness.

161098.name: A-Ö
161098.description: This is a word game, where you try to name things that start with different letters. On your turn you roll a die and one other player takes a card and reads a category from the corresponding line. Now you try to name as many things from that category as you can. You have on note block with alfabet and you can cross out all the starting letters that you could use. When you run out of time, it's next players turn. On your next turn you get new category and try to get the remaining letters. First player who can cross out all the letters is the winner.

161099.name: Sine Requie: Mare Nostrum
161099.description:
From the blurb (translated):

This sourcebook describes the Mediterranean Sea in the aftermath of the Awakening.

161100.name: Sine Requie: Schiavi!
161100.description:
From the blurb (translated):

In this adventure, made to be used with the “Mare Nostrum” sourcebook, the PCs is captured by a pirate ship and brought to a place where horror is commonplace.

161101.name: Sine Requie: Espana
161101.description:
From the blurb (translated):

This sourcebook describes Spain in the aftermath of the Awakening.

161102.name: Seikkailu Joella: Unicefin Vesipeli
161102.description: This is educational childrens game about water. You roll and move and follow the instructions where you land. Basically you go forward, backward or just stay where you landed. On every space there is information about water and things you can do with the water. Winner is the first player to arrive in the end zone.

161103.name: Maverick Bird
161103.description:
User Summary

Maverick Bird is Terry Cavanagh's tribute to Flappy Bird. You're controlling an abstract cube that must navigate obstacles in a psychedelic landscape, that look similar to Cavanagh's previous game, Spuer Hexagon.

This flash game features music by Kozilek.

161104.name: Hyperborea: The Northern Polar Region of Mars
161104.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

This article deals with Hyperborea, the northern polar region of the Red Planet. The topography and climate of the southern polar region are fairly similar, but its flora and fauna are completely different, since evolution in the two areas has been separate with no opportunity for any creatures to migrate between them (look at the dissimilar animals of Earth's Arctic and Antarctica to see the magnitude of the differences).

161105.name: Schutzgebiet Westdioscuria
161105.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The Germany military became interested in establishing a presence on Mars at the end of the 1870s, when they saw what advantages the British had gained from the Red Planet, like liftwood airships that could topple the military balance in Europe.

161106.name: Mars: Gold in the Wild North
161106.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Suddenly the rumour is all over Mars: gold has been found in the Trans-Polodaari hills at the sources of the Maariti creek, northeast of the city-state of Polodaar. Adventurous individuals journey to that area to make their fortunes, turning it into an ill-administered and turbulent place for about five years (after which the gold is depleted). This is the background for some adventures involving the PCs’ attempts to strike it rich in a lawless land.

161107.name: Kalastuspeli
161107.description: This is a roll and move board game, where you try to catch fish. Every player has a boat, which he/she uses to go round the board fishing. There is 40 fishes in the board and the game ends, when there is only four fishes left on the board. The winner is the player who has the biggest catch at the end. Some spaces in the board causes player to lose his/her turn until he/she roll a certain number with the die.

161108.description:
Step into the shoes of an interstellar admiral in just a few minutes. With your fleet of powerful spaceships, enter the zone of battle in which frigates and battleship compete tirelessly under your command for supremacy over the known universe.

Fleet Commander: 1 – Ignition is a space battle game with miniatures for two players. Each player controls a fleet of seven ships on a 5x5 checkered board, which may integrate terrain features such as asteroid fields. In turn, a player chooses three dice among his command dice, throws them and either acts according to the outcomes or saves the dice on his command bridge for following rounds. There are dice to move, attack, and put energy into the shields.

Fleet Commander: 1 – Ignition has been designed to make epic space battles easy to play and to enjoy without having to remove the living room table, acquire many miniatures, or learn complex rules. The whole atmosphere of such battles is transcribed here in one "small" box with a simple but deep game system and beautiful miniatures.

High replayability! With a modular board, six special weapons to equip the battleships, advanced and optional rules and four scenarios, no battle will be the same.

The game system of Fleet Commander: 1 – Ignition is flexible and allows many extensions, with four in the works ahead of the game's release in late 2014.
161108.name: Fleet Commander: 1 – Ignition

161109.name: Speakeasy
161109.description:
It's the 1920s during the time of Prohibition and its famous speakeasies. Will you succeed in finding your opponent's speakeasy with your clan of gangsters before he finds yours?

To set up Speakeasy, each player places his 25 pieces on the game board with the values visible only to him. Players then take turns moving along the streets and alleys, even entering the buildings that serve as a "stash". When two pieces meet, the piece with the highest value scares away the opponent, removing him from the city. Special pieces move faster than others or scare away all opponents before disappearing themselves.

Inspired by Lu Zhan Qi, a Chinese game that has proven its excellence for many years, Speakeasy requires memory and anticipation in games full of bluffing.

161111.name: Victory Under Sail
161111.description:
Victory Under Sail (VUS) is a quick-playing miniatures game of fleet naval battle during the last century of the age of sailing warships. It is designed for a small number of players to recreate the larger battles of this era in a reasonable time. It is not an overly simple game, but it is designed to have simple and quick mechanics to speed play.

Each side has a fleet of ships (represented by counters or miniatures) subdivided into squadrons. VUS is based on squadron maneuvers rather than individual ship movement, although each ship is individually moved within the requirements of the planned maneuver. The movement system uses a true 12-direction movement system on a hex grid that is unique among games of this genre. Squadron maneuver cards and random event cards recreate the challenges of command & control of a fleet of sailing warships.

VUS uses a “Hordes o’Dice System” for combat that is based on the use of different types of dice to represent various types of cannon batteries. The dice mimic the results of a traditional combat results table without the need to reference charts.

The game includes more than 30 scenarios from 3 wars.

161112.name: Magical Circle
161112.description:
The game is involving pattern recognition & building. Players act as students of the school of magic and wizardry, who compete with one another to learn new magic. Each player will join three different magical circles, and determine the number of times of path conversion made within the time limit, to quickly change the magical element into the correct magical circles. It is a game where speed of thought is contested.
The number of times of path conversion is controlled by cards, so players need to be aware whether or not there are suitable cards to use, or if one thinks too fast but lacks a usable card, he or she will have a small price to pay.

161113.name: Trouble Maker
161113.description: Trouble Maker is a pattern building game. Players will exchange game tokens within 8 rounds to get rid of the trouble maker and earn points. When Trouble Makers of the same color form a line, then that line counts as one riddance. If after a game token is flipped over, more Trouble Makers create a line, then the player can continue to flip over more tokens to count as riddance points. The fun of the games is to create multiple lines everywhere and earn very high scores. Trouble Maker is a two player game, so enjoy the fun of continuous good riddance and win points!

161115.name: Critical Missions: SPACE
161115.description:
Critical Missions: SPACE, rejuvenated from SWAT version, coming to FPS lovers in a whole new package with different designs, maps and weapons, but the amazement remains. If you love Critical Missions: SWAT, you’ll love Critical Missions: SPACE too.

Critical Missions: SPACE key features:
- Cross platform FPS between mobile, web and Mac players.
- Multiplayer mode: Local network and game servers globally (USA, EU, Asia, Japan)
- Single player mode: Players vs. customizable bots.
- Game modes: Classic, Team Death Match (TDM), Alien Mode, Survival, Death Match, Juggernaut and Capture the Flag (CTF)
- Tons of pre–installed and downloadable maps
- Cool Aliens and Space’s customized laser guns

Weapons:
Knive, Laser Pistol (PP-30), Laser Assault Rifles (SRX-360 & AF-192), Laser Sniper Rifle (CMSSG), Laser Shotgun (EMPW-9845), Grenades, and a lot more coming to the shop.

Source: The Developer Website.

161116.name: My Pet Protector
161116.description:
User Summary

My Pet Protector is an RPG. You instruct an apprentice and each week must decide whether to make them work, attend school, or adventure. Each activity affects the apprentice's stats and costs some amount of stress points. Become too stressed and you must spent time resting.

Most of the game is menu-driven but the adventuring takes the form of a dungeon plan. You choose where to step and reveal more passageways, enemies and treasure. Fighting an enemy is done RPG-style with you selecting to attack or use magic, trying to decrease the enemy's HP before your own are gone.

The game lasts over 208 weeks until your apprentice turns 18.

161117.name: Tau Character Guide
161117.description:
From the Introduction:

What is the Tau Character Guide

This product provides Rogue Trader players with all the necessary information and rules to play Tau Explorers. Included in this supplement is a concise history of the Tau Empire, rules to play Tau Warriors of the Fire Caste, and an armoury from which to outfit characters with the advanced technology of the Tau.

161118.description:
Originally marketed as part of the "Promo Pack" for the 4th Edition's Kickstarter, the Promo Pack was split into 6 "Expansion Packs", which Game Salute has been slowly releasing to retail.

Components


4 Alien Tech Cards (for use with Alien Frontiers)
Alien Sarcophagus
Auto Pilot A.I.
Bio-Integration Circuit
Chrono-Spike

2 Agenda Cards (for use with Alien Frontiers: Factions)
6 Player Reference Cards
1 Alien Frontiers Decal Sheet
161118.name: Alien Frontiers: Expansion Pack #1

161119.name: Autotest
161119.description: The cars of the players (or teams) have to pass 9 different performance tests. For each test they get awarded points, which are determined by a spinner. A second car of the same color marks the points on the circle at the center of the game board. The player who gets the most points after 9 tests wins the game. So basically each player or team spins 9 times and whoever spins the most points wins.

161120.description:
Originally marketed as part of the "Promo Pack" for the 4th Edition's Kickstarter, the Promo Pack was split into 6 "Expansion Packs", which Game Salute has been slowly releasing to retail.

Contents

4 Alien Tech Cards (for use with Alien Frontiers)
Deflector Shield
Field Amplifier
Field Propagator
Fleet Interlink

2 Agenda Cards (for use with Alien Frontiers: Factions)
5 Facility Reference Cards
1 Blank Alien Tech Card
161120.name: Alien Frontiers: Expansion Pack #2

161121.description:
Originally marketed as part of the "Promo Pack" for the 4th Edition's Kickstarter, the Promo Pack was split into 6 "Expansion Packs", which Game Salute has been slowly releasing to retail.

Contents

4 Alien Tech Cards (for use with Alien Frontiers)
Graviton Shunt
Infiltration A.I.
Infinity Mirror
Magnetic Lockdown

3 Faction Reference Cards
Corex Conflomerated
Dark Space Explorers
Homesteader's Union


2 Agenda Cards (for use with Alien Frontiers: Factions)
2 Blank Alien Tech Card
1 Blank Agenda Card
161121.name: Alien Frontiers: Expansion Pack #3

161122.description:
Originally marketed as part of the "Promo Pack" for the 4th Edition's Kickstarter, the Promo Pack was split into 6 "Expansion Packs", which Game Salute has been slowly releasing to retail.

Contents

4 Alien Tech Cards (for use with Alien Frontiers)
Nano-Recycler
Null-Time Vault
Probability Focus
Resonating Beacon

3 Faction Reference Cards
New Gaia Engineers
Proxima Centauri Sch.
Scavenger Fleet


2 Agenda Cards (for use with Alien Frontiers: Factions)
2 Blank Alien Tech Card
1 Blank Agenda Card
161122.name: Alien Frontiers: Expansion Pack #4

161123.description:
Originally marketed as part of the "Promo Pack" for the 4th Edition's Kickstarter, the Promo Pack was split into 6 "Expansion Packs", which Game Salute has been slowly releasing to retail.

Contents

4 Alien Tech Cards (for use with Alien Frontiers)
Retrieval Webbing
Shipfitter Drone
Superconductor Grapple
Suppression Matrix

3 Faction Reference Cards
Smuggler's Alliance
Uranian Syndicat
Xeno Exploration Inc


2 Agenda Cards (for use with Alien Frontiers: Factions)
2 Blank Alien Tech Card
1 Blank Agenda Card
161123.name: Alien Frontiers: Expansion Pack #5

161124.description:
Originally marketed as part of the "Promo Pack" for the 4th Edition's Kickstarter, the Promo Pack was split into 6 "Expansion Packs", which Game Salute has been slowly releasing to retail.

Contents

7 Salvage Cards (for use with Alien Frontiers: Outer Belt)
Cargo Salvage
Cometary Fragment
Hyperspace Pilot
Message Buoy
Orbital Debris
Raider's Rock
Ship's Lifeboat

3 Alien Tech Cards (for use with Alien Frontiers)
Tele-Operator
Peta-Bit Processor
Scout Drone

1 Outer Belt Reference Card
1 Agenda Cards (for use with Alien Frontiers: Factions)
161124.name: Alien Frontiers: Expansion Pack #6

161125.description: Terrain is a game of bluffing, luck and landscapes, a game of hex tiles representing land types. Each player has a secret tile that denotes which type he scores. Everyone takes turns picking a new tile from the bag and placing it. The winner is the one with the largest connected region of his type. The game of Terrain consists of a few more rules than this, as well as an advanced game in which the same mechanisms are played out in rounds, with each player having a hand of tiles.
161125.name: Terrain

161126.description:
Another Earth. A different 1947. The Second World War has raged for nearly a decade and its grip has spread to every continent on the planet. War has advanced swiftly and strangely in the Dust universe through the application of Alien VK technology — a limitless source of energy in its simplest form, and an unthinkable weapon in the wrong hands. Out of the mind of Paolo Parente comes the world of Dust, a world where tanks have evolved into powerful combat walkers, where rocket troops take to the skies and the latest laser cannon, phasers, and Tesla weapons rule.

For the first time, Dust Tactics is available as a stand-alone rulebook!

The rulebook is a 112 page full-colour hardback book contains everything that you need to know to play Dust Tactics, with clearly illustrated rules examples, platoon organisations, special rules and missions.
161126.name: Dust Tactics

161127.name: My Pet Protector: Generation II
161127.description:
User Summary

My Pet Protector: Generation II builds on the previous game in the series and brings in more options. Players now look after an apprentice for seven years, from age 12 to 19, with one turn per week. You decide whether to study, work, adventure in dungeons or rest. Your village has been destroyed by raiders so you can repair and upgrade buildings with the resources and gold found in dungeons. Better gear makes you more powerful in combat and you can craft your own weapons. The ultimate aim is to level up your apprentice enough to become a hero.

161128.name: March of War
161128.description:
Free-to-play episodic online turn-based strategy game

March of War is an online episodic turn based strategy war game set in an alternate 1940s conflict. Six unique factions fight for power in intense turn based 3D battles, that call upon all of the player's wits and strategic expertise. The object is world domination! Players are offered a rich mix of dieselpunk weaponry that will be familiar to players of the Iron Grip series. By voting on the Vote4War website, players can decide on which new and improved units and characters they would like to see in that months episode, as well as a number of other key game areas.

Source: The Publisher Website.

161129.name: Who's Riding on the Bus?
161129.description:
The animals are out for a fun ride.

Move your bus around your game board searching for the one winning solution that matches how the animals are sitting in the bus. Be the first player to find it... and you win!

This is a children's learning game that focuses on: matching, image recognition, and concentration.

161130.name: Pig
161130.description:
Each turn, a player repeatedly rolls a die until either a 1 is rolled or the player decides to "hold":


If the player rolls a 1, they score nothing and it becomes the next player's turn.
If the player rolls any other number, it is added to their turn total and the player's turn continues.
If a player chooses to "hold", their turn total is added to their score, and it becomes the next player's turn.


The first player to score 100 or more points wins.

161132.name: Nether Runner
161132.description:
User Summary

A sidescrolling action game that after filling out the upgrades plays like a shoot 'em up. While in your cabin a tentacle grabs your female companion and you are off to do battle in this Lovecraft inspired game.

You have fire magic missiles and have a limited ability to fly which consumes fuel when used (when you run out of fuel you can still jump). A wide variety of enemies attack you on the way to the final boss.

Upgrade several types of abilities and power and magic spells. Even unlock enemies that carry powerups when defeated. There are also a number of achievements that must be completed prior to being able to defeat the final boss.

161133.description: This promo card was available at Origins 2014. It features alternate art for the "War World" card included in the base set and carries the "Origins 2014" label. Otherwise it is identical to the card in the base set.
161133.name: Star Realms: War World Alternate Art Promo Card

161134.name: Abyss Odyssey
161134.description:
User Summary

A powerful wizard's nightmares manifest and infest the place. One of three playable characters must make their way through randomly generated dungeons to get to the source.

161136.name: Poochie Giant Card Game
161136.description:
From the back of the box:

Poochie challenges players to a friendly game of tug-of-war. The object of play is to build the longest length of rope between Poochie and her boyfriend, Fastball. Players take turns drawing cards and placing them in a row in front of them. When a player has a Poochie card at one end and a Fastball card at the other end, she is out of play. The remaining players continue play until they have also completed their ropes and dropped out of play. The winner is the player with the most rope cards between the characters.

161137.description:
Game Play Variants: There are 2 game play variants of the game, 1 vs 1 and the free-for-all 3 way battle. The Recommended Variant is the 3 player free-for-all game which is the basic setup of the game's gameplay. The game can be played 1 versus 1 which will still use the play mat and will still use the unit positioning area such as the left/right flank unit placement.

Game Objective: Reduce all opponents’ Leader life Points to zero.

Game Setup:

1. Select Race Players choose which race they wish to play and thoroughly shuffle their decks. Pass each deck counter-clockwise to next player for reshuffling until it goes back to the designated player.

2. Place Leader Card Each player must place their leader Card in the field (playmat designated area). A Leader Card starts with 30 Health Points. (If a leader’s life points drops to zero, that player is eliminated from the game).

3. Determine Play Order Randomly select which player will go first. After the first player’s turn, player turn order will resume in a counter-clockwise direction.

4. Draw Hand Cards All players must draw 6 cards from their chosen deck. Every play turn, players can draw 2 cards in their library. All players can assign up to 2 cards on the mining placement area which will produce 1 gold per card per turn. The more cards assigned to the mining area, the more gold it produces. However, re-assigning the cards/using the cards from the mining area has an additional cost of 4 gold. It is the penalty for the cards being re-assigned as unit in the field.

5. First Turn The first player begins their turn and performs the actions described in the Play Sequence section of these rules.

Game Play Sequence:

These are all the actions a player may perform during their turn. Each action must be completed in the order designated below. In a free-for-all game, the player chosen to go first takes their turn. Next, in a consecutive order (going in a counter-clockwise direction), the other players will fulfill their turns.

1. Re-draw (Optional) A player can elect to declare a Re-Draw action at the start of their turn. This action is performed in place of any of the regular actions associated with a typical turn. When a player has no useful cards in their hand, they can choose to use the Re-draw action. The Re-Draw action allows a player to discard their hand of cards and draw 6 new cards from their deck. This action ends their turn. The player is not allowed to take any more actions, and will not be able to produce any Gold until their next turn. Note: If you don’t need to Re-Draw, skip this action and take a normal turn. Simply begin your turn with the collect Gold action and precede through the subsequent action steps until you wrap up your turn with the Upkeep action.

2. Collect Gold Collect the amount of Gold equal to the total Gold on all of the cards placed on the mining area.

3. Draw Card Draw 2 cards from your Race deck.

4. Activate Cards This action lets you establish and activate any type of cards, use Command cards, and/or assign new units. During this play sequence, a player may perform all four of these options: - Play 2 Card to the mining field. Note: All cards in the mining field should be placed facedown. - Play any number of Passive and Instant Command Cards. - Play any unit cards to assign any number of new units on the left/right flank.

5. Re-assign Once the unit is re-assigned from mining area to any of the field flank, it cannot go back to the mining area. However, once a unit is assigned to any flank, you can re-assign it the other flank with a cost of 2 gold.

For further information of the game's "How to play", please download the game's Rule Book.
161137.name: Blood Oath: The Beginning

161138.description:
In Dragon Run, the players have just raided a dragon's keep, picked up a bunch of loot, and awakened the dragon. Now it's time to flee, ideally making it out with both our treasures and our lives.

On each turn, a player can either advance boldly, flee cautiously, or cry like a baby. If you advance boldly, you draw a card from the location deck, which holds three types of cards: one that allows that player to either redraw or stop, one that grants new treasure from the treasure hall, and (of course) the dragon. If you draw the dragon, you lose one health point (out of two), the dragon calms down (i.e., it loses one temper point), and the location deck is reshuffled. If you're injured twice, you die and are out of the game.

When fleeing cautiously, you first discard a treasure worth at least one coin, then roll a d10. If your roll is higher than the number of cards in the location deck, the dragon calms down, then you reshuffle the location deck; otherwise you must draw a card from the location deck just as when someone advances boldly. Your sacrificed treasure is still lost.

When you cry like a baby, you don't draw a location card, instead discarding a treasure worth at least two coins. Having shown your obeisance to the dragon, the turn passes to the next player.

Players start with four treasure cards; while some cards are worth 1-5 coins, others provide a one-shot potion or a talisman that stays in effect until the location deck is shuffled, which ends the round. Gameplay lasts from 5 to 8 rounds. Each player has a unique power that can be used once per round: the thief can steal cards from opponents, the cleric can heal opponents in exchange for treasure, etc. If the dragon loses its final temper point, the game ends and whoever holds the most valuable treasure wins; if all of the adventurers are charred to death first, then the dragon wins instead!
161138.name: Dragon Run

161139.name: Pocket Rugby League
161139.description:
From the publisher:

Pocket Rugby League is head smashing, scrum packing, ball and all Rugby - played with dice.
We've made this game to give plenty of scoring chances...in fact, not scoring in an attacking raid might be more painful than the huge hits throughout the game.
The gameplay focuses on each side taking turns in an attacking set of 6 tackles.
You are in control of 5 playing positions - the scrum half always starts each passage of play. He will either pass to another position, kick for a field goal or try and gain ground. On the other 4 dice, there is a 1 in 6 chance of 'busting' the line of defense, at which point, your opponent has one more roll of the 'Defensive' die to try and stop the try scoring effort.
If he succeeds, it is recorded as a tackle in the set of 6 and the attack continues. If he can't stop the try, the attackers then gets to roll the TRY / NO TRY dice.
3 in 6 chance of a TRY / 2 in 6 chance of NO TRY and 1 chance the VIDEO ref is called upon to review the tape - in which a re-roll of the TRY die is made.
