Five hundred years after magic’s return, the remnants of our technological heritage live in the few remaining bastions—cities like ones of present day, but walled in against the encroaching magic surrounding it.

Will mankind be able to retake the planet and push the fantasy back into the realms of our imagination, able to resume our bind passion for consumerism and industrialization? Is this world better than the one mankind squandered?

Hearts of Chaos is an introductory module for Amethyst. It includes new rules and pregenerated characters for those wanting to get right into the action.

The players take the role of members of an international techan mercenary company tasked with a critical mission: Venture into a no-man’s land where few humans have been, find a rogue former colonel in lie with those born of magic, and kill him.

This adventure includes:

Five Pregenerated characters
All the basic rules from Amethyst required for play.
Eleven monsters unique to the Amethyst setting.
3.75-compliant rules to add technology to any Pathfinder game

161233.name: Hearts of Chaos Revised (4E)
161233.description:
From publisher blurb:


Remastered with new content and updated rules!

Amethyst is a Role Playing Game presenting a world where a true-to-book fantasy setting is forced upon our real world. How would humanity respond? This is not some stylized view of Earth seen in books and on TV. It’s a world with all the problems, both social and political, intact.

All the basic rules from Amethyst required for play.
Eleven monsters unique to the Amethyst setting.
4E-compliant rules to add technology to any game

161234.name: Landscape: The Manse
161234.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Manse stands, grand and sprawling, mysterious. Beyond the facade, vast potential awaits. What will you make of it..?

Landscape: The Manse is a tool designed to support the development of locations of this general type. On just one page it provides 36 map elements, five possible connectors, four tables for further depth, and a host of ideas for potential natures.

It is compatible with various genres and systems and suitable for use in roleplaying and beyond. It can be used as a source of ready layouts for specific locations, as well as to inspire, arrange and detail locations, even at the table in the course of games.

The map elements can be used at the given scale, possibly with 1:285 (6mm) scale miniatures, or redrawn as required in play.

The two pages are arranged for ease of use on screen or printed, the key features occupying a single page. The tool includes:

36 map elements arranged in six groups of six, all on one page
five suggested connecting elements, one for each element type
four tables - for orientation, doors, landscape beyond and stairs
18 proposals for the overarching nature of the entire complex
a large number of suggestions for individual element natures
a compact diceless number generator for the specific range used




The tool can be used with Narrative: Abandoned Space, the map elements acting as a setting or structure for development, as well as with Elaboration: Structure & Surface, which provides 540 descriptive terms for adding more detail to locations.

161235.name: Elaboration: Structure & Surface
161235.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shapes loom - unknown in their form, material and texture, in element and layer, significance. What will they be for you..?

Elaboration: Structure & Surface is a tool designed to support the development of locations of various types. On just one page it provides 540 descriptive terms across six tables, with a table for extent and a diagram for generating orientation.

It is compatible with various genres and systems and suitable for use in roleplaying and beyond. It can be used both to inspire locations and to detail them in terms of form, material, texture, element, layer and significance, even in the course of games.

The three pages are arranged for ease of use on screen or printed, the key features in two variant layouts. The tool includes:

540 descriptive terms arranged in six main tables, all on one page
the option of generating terms in a range of three columns or five
a diagram for finding orientation, six points on each of two axes
a table suggesting an extent, i.e. the specific surface(s) involved
a compact diceless number generator for the two ranges used




The tool can be used with Narrative: Abandoned Space and tools like Landscape: The Manse and Location: Crawling Gorge to develop features of the sites further.

161236.name: Elaboration: Atmosphere & Liquid
161236.description:
From publisher blurb:

Waters and airs await - unknown in their volume, fluid and behaviour, in boundary and load, effect. What will they be for you..?

Elaboration: Atmosphere & Liquid is a tool designed to support the development of locations of various types. On just one page it provides 540 descriptive terms across six tables, with a table for extent and a diagram for generating orientation.

It is compatible with various genres and systems and suitable for use in roleplaying and beyond. It can be used both to inspire locations and to detail them in terms of volume, fluid, behaviour, boundary, load and effect, even in the course of games.

The three pages are arranged for ease of use on screen or printed, the key features in two variant layouts. The tool includes:

540 descriptive terms arranged in six main tables, all on one page
the option of generating terms in a range of three columns or five
a diagram for finding orientation, six points on each of two axes
a table suggesting an extent, i.e. the specific region(s) involved
a compact diceless number generator for the two ranges used




The tool can be used with Narrative: Abandoned Space, to expand two of the 12 elaboration categories - the atmosphere and liquid of the title - as well as with the first entry in the series, Elaboration: Structure & Surface. It can also be used with maps like those given in The Acrid Well, The Low Mere and The Livid Run to develop the various volumes further.

161237.name: Events: Screeside – The Gloaming
161237.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shudders wrack the mountainous shore of dead, dread Screeside. Ashes rise over shimmering peaks, the evergreen slopes slipping in slides of mud. Dusk falls in day. The rains begin...

Events: Screeside - The Gloaming is a tool designed to support the development of narratives set in Screeside - a weird, ostensibly fantasy shore alongside a sea or great lake - as well as similar locations in other worlds. On just one page it provides 66 seed sentences, lined up with a simple map of the shore, and a table for finding the next seed sentence in a sequence.

It is compatible with various genres and systems and suitable for use in roleplaying and beyond. It can be used as a source of events and rumours for the location, as well as to inspire encounters and scenarios, even at the table in the course of games.

The two pages are arranged for ease of use on screen or printed, the key features occupying a single page. The tool includes:

66 seed sentences arranged in six columns of 11, all on one page
a simple map with six numbered stretches and 12 marked regions
a table for finding the next seed sentence in a sequence randomly
a compact diceless number generator for the two ranges used




The tool can be used with Narrative: Abandoned Space, which uses Screeside as a setting for one of the example narratives, as well as with Landscape: The Manse, the map elements of which may be suitable for the manses mentioned in one of the sentences, and Elaboration: Structure & Surface, which provides 540 descriptive terms for adding detail to locations.

161238.name: Events: Goings-on Seen or Heard of in the Olde Worlde Settlement
161238.description:
From publisher blurb:

"We made it: civilisation at last! Fresh food, a proper bed. Ordinary people with simple lives. Safety! Wait - They're doing what..?"

Events: Goings-on Seen or Heard of in the Olde Worlde Settlement is a tool designed to prompt encounters and other events.

On just one page it provides 216 table entries arranged across six columns, for use individually or in various combinations.

The entries cover the activity itself, its nature and location, plus the people and things involved, and those getting involved...

It is compatible with various genres and systems and suitable for use in roleplaying and beyond. It can be used to inspire and detail beings, even at the table in the course of games - and not least to see out what kind of place it is the party just found...

The three pages are arranged for ease of use on screen or printed, the key features in two variant layouts. The tool includes:

216 table entries arranged in six columns and six rows, all on one page
six categories - nature, activity, location, individual, other party and escalation
a compact diceless number generator for a specific range used




It can be used in conjunction with the adventures The Winds of Foul Crack and The Loss in Hanging Well to add detail to the district around Old Wranglie's, the towns of New Churning and Rict and the settlements growing beyond the Underdelta.

161239.name: Being: More or Less Fantastical Olde Worlde Technologies
161239.description:
From publisher blurb:

"I've got weapons, armour, a baggage train, a household, but... There's more. More than my artificers can make. There's that..."

Being: More or Less Fantastical Olde Worlde Technologies is a tool designed to support development of certain beings.

On just one page it provides 216 table entries arranged across six columns, for use individually or in various combinations.

The entries cover aspects of form, function and behaviour, along with specific parts and their nature, including glitches...

It is compatible with various genres and systems and suitable for use in roleplaying and beyond. It can be used to inspire and detail beings, even at the table in the course of games - and not least to find out what it is the party just stumbled across...

The three pages are arranged for ease of use on screen or printed, the key features in two variant layouts. The tool includes:

216 table entries arranged in six columns and six rows, all on one page
six categories - appearance, feature, structure, detail, element and glitch
a smaller multi-purpose table for status, levels and relative positions
a compact diceless number generator for a specific range used




It can be used in conjunction with Elaboration: Structure & Surface, which has 540 descriptive terms for detailing locations.

161241.name: Character: Odds & Ends Found on the Olde Worlde Adventurer
161241.description:
From publisher blurb:

"I check all my belts, rummage right to the bottom of every pouch and empty my whole pack out on the ground. What do I find?"

Character: Odds & Ends Found on the Olde Worlde Adventurer is a tool designed to support development of characters.

On just one page it provides 216 table entries of possible possessions, plus a set of locations and six tables for further depth.

Expect to find anything from dust, blossom or unidentified shavings - maybe even a lodestone chip - through domestic rubbish, odd knick-knacks and more - ahem - 'personal' articles, right up to bits of the landscape, tools and a range of entertainments.

It is compatible with various genres and systems and suitable for use in roleplaying and beyond. It can be used to inspire and detail characters, even at the table in the course of games, not least to find out what a desperate character might be carrying.

The three pages are arranged for ease of use on screen or printed, the key features in two variant layouts. The tool includes:

216 table entries arranged in six columns and six rows, all on one page
a set of possible locations, in terms of fixing, body section and height
six more tables - for crust, stain, odour, marking, design and source
a compact diceless number generator for the three ranges used
a simple diagram designed to help in shifting the range of results

161242.name: Character: More or Less Promising Olde Worlde Adventurers
161242.description:
From publisher blurb:

"I've got stats and skills and this or that special rule, but... Who in the world am I? Who are the rest of you? And who's that..?"

Character: More or Less Promising Olde Worlde Adventurers is a tool designed to support development of characters.

On just one page it provides 216 table entries arranged across six columns, for use individually or in various combinations.

The entries cover aspects of appearance, personality and behaviour, plus approach and current circumstances with regard to occupation, as well as origin geographically and socially, physical and psychological nature and explicit and implicit relationships.

It is compatible with various genres and systems and suitable for use in roleplaying and beyond. It can be used to inspire and detail characters, even at the table in the course of games - and not least to find out who it is the party has just bumped into...

The three pages are arranged for ease of use on screen or printed, the key features in two variant layouts. The tool includes:

216 table entries arranged in six columns and six rows, all on one page
six categories - characteristic, situation, occupation, origin, nature and connection
a compact diceless number generator for the specific range used




It complements Character: Odds & Ends Found on the Olde Worlde Adventurer, which lists various possible possessions.

161243.name: World: Shale
161243.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dust. Stones. Great rocks. They rain from the sky. They are the sky. Gravels, rubbles and boulders. All the way down. So hollow! But for the waters... There are worlds in there. And out there too. Old worlds. Dead worlds. The dead themselves...

Looking for a weird new world to explore? Need some ready inspiration, but prefer to be left the space to make it your own?

World: Shale is a tool for this purpose. On just one page it introduces the world of Shale and provides a seed for each of six factions or facets, 36 related activities, six major locations, 36 local items or technologies and a set of ideas for getting there.

The single page is arranged for ease of use on screen or printed and includes:

an introduction to Shale, world of shifting stone
six seed passages, for factions or facets of the world
36 possible activities, six for each of the seed passages
six descriptions of major locations in the known regions
a simple stylised map for a sense of the landscape
36 local items or technologies for interpretation
a set of suggestions for routes into the world




Shale could also be home to the weird shore of Screeside, which features in both Events: Screeside – The Gloaming and Narrative: Abandoned Space, and could even be an adjacent region to the gyroscapes, also featured in Abandoned Space.

161244.name: The Lost Dig
161244.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you need a themed map now, with plenty of prompts to inspire adventure - ahead of time or at the table - look no further...

Landscape: The Lost Dig is a tool containing two versions of a detailed map: one of them pre-marked and the other blank.

The first version is marked with six locations (junction, store, sump, excavation, warren and retreat), each given a table of six possible encounters or discoveries. The map is also marked with six access points and the page has six possible rumour seeds.

The second version has no lettering or numbering, to make it easier for you to adapt it to the circumstances in your world.

Each map can be used as it is, possibly in conjunction with 1:285 (6mm) scale miniatures, or redrawn as required in play.

The tool is compatible with various genres and systems and suitable for use in roleplaying and beyond. It can be used as all or part of an adventure site, or the basis for one, as well as to inspire events at the site, even at the table in the course of games.

The three pages are arranged for ease of use on screen or printed, each version occupying a single page. The tool includes:

two versions of a detailed map - one of them pre-marked, the other blank
six marked locations - junction, store, sump, excavation, warren and retreat
six tables, one per marked location, each with six encounters or discoveries
six possible rumour seeds relating to the map, for expansion or inspiration




The tool can be used with Narrative: Abandoned Space, the map elements acting as a setting or structure for development. It can also be used in representing the kind of subterranean space suggested in World: Shale or a section of the tunnels running through the weird mountainous shore of Screeside, as featured in Abandoned Space and Events: Screeside – The Gloaming.

161245.description: Hansa Teutonica: Score Sheet is a dry-erase board on which to calculate the scores at the end of the game, allowing for easier scoring so you don't have to reference the rules for all of the scoring methods!
161245.name: Hansa Teutonica: Score Sheet

161254.description:
From publisher blurb:

Landscape: The Ferrous Thicket is a set of 36 wilderness areas located in and around the titular forest, all laid out on a single page.

It is intended for use alone or as part of a larger world, possibly within or centred on a map square or hex. The material is suitable for rules-light gaming and designed for easy adaptation to various settings and systems, describing elements with a degree of uncertainty in terms open to interpretation. It assumes that dice are used for random numbers, but also offers a diceless number generator.

The package includes a copy of isophasmic light, a compact approach to gaming used in the creation of the profiles.

The three pages are arranged for ease of use on screen or printed, the key features in two variant layouts. The tool includes:

36 location descriptions corresponding to a site layout, all on one page
six rumours, six wanderers, 18 item entries and 18 descriptive terms
a compact diceless number generator for three of the ranges used




The possible subterranean network below the Thicket could be represented by one or more entries in the themed maps series.

161255.name: Location: Crawling Gorge
161255.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some still follow the Old Road, but the journey is a far harder and more dangerous prospect than once it was...

If you need an adventure site now, with plenty of prompts to inspire the action - ahead of time or at the table - look no further...

Location: Crawling Gorge is a tool designed to support the development of narratives set in and around this location. On just one page it provides a map for six sub-locations marked with a set of possible encounters involving six individuals, factions or lifeforms, as well as six possible events for context, a table for travellers present and a basic warren generation method.

It is compatible with various genres and systems and suitable for use in roleplaying and beyond, allowing the user to decide exact natures. It can be used as a resource for this specific site or similar locations, even at the table in the course of games.

The three pages are arranged for ease of use on screen or printed, the key features in two variant layouts. The tool includes:

a map marked with six sub-locations and a set of possible encounters
six character sources - individuals, factions or lifeforms party to the encounters
further description for each of the sub-locations, individuals, factions and lifeforms
a 12-entry table for identifying the nature of the travellers present or passing by
a simple method of generating layouts for the warrens located at the gorge
a compact diceless number generator for the four ranges used




The tool can be used with Narrative: Abandoned Space, the site acting as a setting or structure for development, as well as with Elaboration: Structure & Surface, which provides 540 descriptive terms for adding detail to locations. The sinkhole running down into the gorge could lead to maps like those given in The Lost Dig, The Low Mere and The Great Pit.

161256.name: The Lust in Skew Hollow
161256.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Ducal Orb is found! But the Duke..?

Does this noble of ancient lineage ride the Wasted Glades while a common captain rules the Tower? Aye...

They call the Duke 'the Heartless', prince fallen to lust; the Schemer stole that heart and keeps it still: in a jar.

But now the Tower calls the willing...

The Lust in Skew Hollow is an adventure with five locations, a map and a set of protagonists, all folding into a pocket format.

The elements weave into a quest for a failing realm on a lonely coast, offering wily adventurers access to powerful figures, an altered people and a source of fuel, as well as knowledge of nefarious scheming. The material is suitable for rules-light gaming and designed for easy adaptation to various settings and systems, describing the key elements with a degree of uncertainty in terms open to interpretation. It assumes that dice are used for random numbers, but also offers a diceless number generator.

The package includes a copy of isophasmic light, a compact approach to gaming used in the creation of the profiles. As with isophasmic light, the adventure is laid out for use as a PolyP booklet, to make it easier to play spontaneously and on the move.

161257.name: The Winds of Foul Crack
161257.description:
From publisher blurb:

Times are good; tables full. Loads roll in over the Caustic Plains from New Churning, where the Young Wind turns great drives and wilds grow tame. New work comes to older realms; new crafts form. Bright vistas stretch away.

Spirit of the age? That's canny Old Wranglie. Pondering even now...

The Winds of Foul Crack is an adventure with five locations, a map and a set of protagonists, all folding into a pocket format.

The elements together allow wily adventurers to explore a change across the wilds of a harsh plain, offering the fruits of a great mind, opportunity with pioneers and knowledge of a potentially apocalyptic event. The material is suitable for rules-light gaming and designed for easy adaptation to various settings and systems, describing the key elements with a degree of uncertainty in terms open to interpretation. It assumes that dice are used for random numbers, but also offers a diceless number generator.

The package includes a copy of isophasmic light, a compact approach to gaming used in the creation of the profiles. As with isophasmic light, the adventure is laid out for use as a PolyP booklet, to make it easier to play spontaneously and on the move.

161258.name: The Loss in Hanging Well
161258.description:
From publisher blurb:

In old Rict, pain haunts every home, fear its sloping lanes. The Officials murder freely.

But uneasily, for they themselves may be next: in Hanging Well, where daemons dwell. Those who choose vengeance go sooner; those who seek other paths follow the Hope.

But now the Hope too is to be hung...

The Loss in Hanging Well is an adventure with five locations, a map and a set of protagonists, all folding into a pocket format.

The elements weave into a chase through the deeps onto the edge of a society, offering wily adventurers the secret of a feared site, access to outlandish beings and opportunities among two emerging peoples. The material is suitable for rules-light gaming and designed for easy adaptation to various settings and systems, describing the key elements with a degree of uncertainty in terms open to interpretation. It assumes that dice are used for random numbers, but also offers a diceless number generator.

The package includes a copy of isophasmic light, a compact approach to gaming used in the creation of the profiles. As with isophasmic light, the adventure is laid out for use as a PolyP booklet, to make it easier to play spontaneously and on the move.

161259.name: Series Pitch: Lay of the Niaislings
161259.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Ainean Empire has stood for a thousand years. While the running dogs and the rabble say it will last a thousand more, you know the truth. Your empire is crumbling. Your empire is doomed. The enemy is at the gate - what will you do?

The Crusades, the Fall of Rome and the Viking invasions meet explosively in this new campaign seed. Written in the format of a Series Pitch for Robin D. Laws' OGL DramaSystem, this short and punchy PDF is a perfect springboard for campaigns using any number of systems. Even better, all our Series Pitches are based on adventures and campaigns played here at Morningstar HQ, so you know they work.

161260.name: The Dragon Horde (Issue 2 - Jun 2014)
161260.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inside this 32-page Nordic-themed issue:

The Monster Roster: Linnorms (Oe/BX/1e information for 6 types)
The Long and Short of the Viking Longhouse (with several sample maps)
Here's the Thing... (folkmotes and fitting them into your adventures)
The Völva: A New NPC Character Class - including several new spells (part seer, part shaman, part wanderer... all woman)
Vifillmein: An Adventure for Characters Levels 1-3
Dealing with Level Drain (a host of alternatives to "by the book" level drain)
The Houses of the Mark: NPC Encounters Adapted from William Morriss The House of the Wolfings (NPC encounters for nearly 2 dozen tribes and their most important members)
A Trio of Norse-inspired Magic Items

161261.name: Bim Bum Bam
161261.description: Are you tired of games ending in a tie — or even being forced to lose in a tie because game designers have no imagination? Do you want fun new ways of choosing the first player in a game? The finely illustrated Bim Bum Bam will transform your ties and give you a way to choose the first player in every game.

rpg.10737: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

161262.name: Nebin Pendlebrook's Perilous Pantry
161262.description:
From publisher blurb:

The tiny village of Bitterweed Barrow is unaccustomed to mysterious tunnels, missing halflings, or the need for brave adventurers, but now it has all three! Can a band of gong-farmers and shoe-cobblers muster the courage to descend into the darkness and confront the terror that waits beyond Nebin Pendlebrook’s unexpectedly perilous pantry?

Designed to be completed in a single furious session, this Instant Action 0-Level Dungeon Crawl Classics adventure drops your players into peril straight away. Dangerous foes, wicked traps, and ancient secrets await!

Features:

42 pages of classic 6'x9' digest-format old-school b/w dungeon fun!
Designed to be completed in a single 4 hour session, perfect for convention or demo play.

161263.name: Eagle to Invisible Stalker
161263.description:
From publisher blurb:

Volume Four of the Super Powered Bestiary provides more than 45 full creature write-ups for giants, genies and an invisible stalker (amongst others), compatible with the 3rd Ed M&M rules. Obviously of great use to anyone running a fantasy-themed game with this ruleset, the Super Power Bestiary also provides options for more traditional supers and masked adventurer games!

Whenever a GM wants the heroes to face off against the Giants of the Nine Realms of Asgard, defeat the Wish Lords of the Middle East, or overcome the Unseen Terror of London's foggy nights, the threats can quickly and easily be drawn from this fourth volume of the Super Powered Bestiary!

161264.description:
Watch your step! The Ruins of Abetan are a treacherous labyrinth of steep cliffs and rickety bridges, but the fabulous Khrysos treasure inside is all that matters to the Khrysos Hunters.

Expand your hunt to up to six players with Khrysos Hunters: Ruins of Abetan Expansion, which includes ten new Hunters to make your team. Jump the gaps, but don't get pushed in!
161264.name: Khrysos Hunters: Ruins of Abetan Expansion

161265.name: Swarm of Chaos

rpgseries.39618: ADCP - Living Forgotten Realms Adventuring Company Adventures

161265.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

Cleansing the infestation beneath the boughs of Cormanthor reveals on the beginning of the corruption. Demon cultists have infiltrated Myth Drannor and the ancient land needs your help to stop their nefarious plot. Swarm of Chaos is a two-round continuous-play Living Forgotten Realms Battle Interactive set in Myth Drannor for characters levels 1-20. This adventure is combat-intensive. Players who do not enjoy combat encounters are less likely to enjoy this adventure. It is recommended that at least three of the characters be members of the same Adventuring Company. This adventure takes place after the events of the SPEC3-1 Roots of Corruption adventures, but playing the adventures in order is not required. This adventure may only be run at Wizards Play Network (WPN) Public Play events. It may not be sanctioned for Private Play.

161266.name: From Dawn till Dusk

rpgseries.39618: ADCP - Living Forgotten Realms Adventuring Company Adventures

161266.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

Netheril has taken over Spellgard – Saharelgard, as they name it now – and are controlling its oracle, the lady Saharel. With reinforcements on the way, soon the pass will be closed and the secrets of the fortress will be theirs. Only a 12 hour window is left to liberate Saharel and prevent the Shades from achieving a major victory. A Living Forgotten Realms Battle Interactive set in Netheril for adventurers of the Heroic and Paragon tiers (character levels 1 – 20). This adventure is designed to run in two very full rounds (11 hours total play time including a one-hour break).

This adventure is combat-intensive. Players who do not enjoy combat encounters are less likely to enjoy this adventure. It is recommended that at least three of the characters be members of the same Adventuring Company. This adventure may only be run at Wizards Play Network (WPN) Public Play events. It may not be sanctioned for Private Play.

161267.name: City of Destinies

rpgseries.39618: ADCP - Living Forgotten Realms Adventuring Company Adventures

161267.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

The city of Myth Nantar is the center of the sea elves' society. Although it once rested entirely beneath the waves of the Sea of Fallen Stars, the changes wrought by the Spellplague exposed Myth Nantar's upper levels to the air. Now the sea elves and the surface races mingle and trade freely here, protected from their enemies by ancient elven high magic. Thanks to the mythal, the citizens of Myth Nantar need not fear the threat of the Abolethic Sovereignty. Or so they believe. A two-round continuous-play Living Forgotten Realms Battle Interactive for characters of the Heroic and Paragon tiers (levels 1-20, but all characters must be of the same tier and able to play at the chosen Adventure Level).
This adventure is combat-intensive, and the combat encounters are more difficult than those in a typical LFR adventure. You will need good resource management, strong teamwork, and a bit of luck to succeed. It is recommended, but not required, that at least three of the characters at the table be members of the same Adventuring Company. This adventure takes place after (and is directly caused by) the events of SPEC4-1 Cerulean Dreams and SPEC4-2 The Writhing Obelisk, but play of the prior adventures is not required or assumed.
The encounters in this adventure are designed to be played using the poster maps that are included with the print products The Book of Vile Darkness and Haunted Temples from Wizards of the Coast. We believe that you will enjoy the adventure more if you use the poster maps, but they are optional.

161268.name: The Lost City of Suldolphor

rpgseries.39618: ADCP - Living Forgotten Realms Adventuring Company Adventures

161268.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

The ever-shifting sands of the Calimshan desert have uncovered the ancient city of Suldolphor. The forces of Calimport, Memnon, and Almraiven converge upon the city, each striving to gain a tactical advantage in their ongoing struggle for supremacy. This adventure is a combat-intensive two-round continuous-play Living Forgotten Realms Battle Interactive for characters of the Heroic and Paragon tiers (levels 1-20, but all characters at the table must be able to play at the group’s chosen Adventure Level, and characters from different tiers may not play together). This adventure is connected to the events of SPEC4-3, SPEC4-4, CALI4-1, CALI4-2, and CALI4-3, but all these adventures may be played in any order. It is recommended, but not required, that at least three characters at the table be members of the same Adventuring Company. This adventure may only be run at Wizards Play Network (WPN) Public Play events. It is not sanctioned for Private Play.

161269.name: Home's Last Light

rpgseries.39618: ADCP - Living Forgotten Realms Adventuring Company Adventures

161269.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

Elturgard has fallen. From the capital of Elturel the fallen Order of Torm, thoroughly corrupted by the Order of the Blue Flame and agents of Najara, has declared an alliance with Netheril. Its borders closed, rumors are rampant of mutagenic plagues changing the populace into monstrous beasts and undead that do not fear the light of day. The remnants of the exiled government have appealed to all enemies of Netheril to aid in retaking the country by starting with a direct strike at the capital itself in an effort to purify and reinvigorate a despoiled Companion. As Cormyr, Myth Drannor and other great powers rally, many see this as the first battle in the coming war with the Empire of Shadows that may result in the Desolation of the Realms.
A two-round continuous-play Living Forgotten Realms Battle Interactive set in Elturgard for characters of the Heroic and Paragon tiers (levels 1-20, but all characters must be of the same tier and able to play at the table's chosen Adventure Level).This battle interactive will allow more opportunities to interact with other tables and some groups may find themselves temporarily shorthanded. You should allow at least 9 hours of play time to run this event (we recommend two 4-hour back-to-back slots with a 1-hour break in the middle). This adventure is combat-intensive, and the combat encounters may be more difficult than those in a typical LFR adventure. You will need good resource management, strong teamwork both at your table and among the entire interactive, as well as a bit of luck in order to succeed. We recommend that at least three of the characters at the table be members of the same Adventuring Company or meta-organization. This adventure takes place after the events of ELTU4-4, SPEC5-1 and SPEC5-2. Play of the prior adventures is recommended, but is neither required nor assumed.

161270.name: Best Defense Round 1

rpgseries.39618: ADCP - Living Forgotten Realms Adventuring Company Adventures

161270.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

There has long been a fragile peace between the shadowy forces of Netheril on one side and the Forest Kingdom of Cormyr and its eladrin allies on the other. The Shade Princes, War Wizards, and High Mages have studied each other's strengths and weaknesses for thousands of years. The only thing that has kept the sides from each other's throats is fear of the utter devastation that an all-out war between such magical giants would cause. Now something has disturbed the precarious balance. The power of Shade Enclave is growing; not even the greatest heroes could prevent the fall of Elturel. If the forces of light don't strike back now, it may soon be too late...
This is Round 1 of a two-round continuous-play Living Forgotten Realms battle interactive set in Netheril for characters of the Heroic and Paragon tiers (levels 1 – 20). This adventure is part of the Desolation series.
Battle Interactives are combat-intensive. Players who do not enjoy combat encounters are less likely to enjoy this adventure. We recommend that event organizers try to run at least five tables of this event, and that at least three of the characters at each table be members of the same Adventuring Company. This adventure may only be run at Wizards Play Network (WPN) Public Play events. It may not be sanctioned for Private Play.

161271.name: Best Defense Round 2

rpgseries.39618: ADCP - Living Forgotten Realms Adventuring Company Adventures

161271.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

There has long been a fragile peace between the shadowy forces of Netheril on one side and the Forest Kingdom of Cormyr and its eladrin allies on the other. The Shade Princes, War Wizards, and High Mages have studied each other's strengths and weaknesses for thousands of years. The only thing that has kept the sides from each other's throats is fear of the utter devastation that an all-out war between such magical giants would cause. Now something has disturbed the precarious balance. The power of Shade Enclave is growing; not even the greatest heroes could prevent the fall of Elturel. If the forces of light don't strike back now, it may soon be too late...
This is Round 2 of a two-round continuous-play Living Forgotten Realms battle interactive set in Netheril for characters of the Heroic and Paragon tiers (levels 1 – 20). This adventure is part of the Desolation series.
Battle Interactives are combat-intensive. Players who do not enjoy combat encounters are less likely to enjoy this adventure. We recommend that event organizers try to run at least five tables of this event, and that at least three of the characters at each table be members of the same Adventuring Company. This adventure may only be run at Wizards Play Network (WPN) Public Play events. It is not sanctioned for Private Play.

161272.name: Dust to Dust Round 1
161272.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

It all comes down to this. You have gathered your allies and tracked your enemies across the great Sea of Silt. They gather around the manifestation of their master: the primordial itself. Will your hasty alliance hold long enough to defeat the creature? Is such a thing even possible? And if you can win, what will the cost be? Ashes of Athas Chapter Seven – Part Two, a 9th level Battle Interactive adventure for the brutal world of Dark Sun and the conclusion to the Ashes of Athas campaign. New players should play AOA7-1 first.

161273.name: Dust to Dust Round 2
161273.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

It all comes down to this. You have gathered your allies and tracked your enemies across the great Sea of Silt. They gather around the manifestation of their master: the primordial itself. Will your hasty alliance hold long enough to defeat the creature? Is such a thing even possible? And if you can win, what will the cost be? Ashes of Athas Chapter Seven – Round 2, a 9th level Battle Interactive adventure for the brutal world of Dark Sun and the conclusion to the Ashes of Athas campaign. All players should play AOA7-2 Round 1 first.

161275.name: Mummy's Mask
161275.description:
From the back of the box:

Tomb Raiders

Lost relics of past ages, the grave goods of forgotten pharaohs, and the regalia of desert kings are all found in this trove of treasures for use in your Mummy's Mask campaign. Each of this set's 54 beautifully illustrated full-color cards includes space on the back for players to add notes on their trasures. These Pathfinder Item Cards are designed for use with the Mummy's Mask Adventure Path, but are compatible with any fantasy roleplaying game.

161276.description:
About the Game

M.I.N.D is a tactical strategy board game set in a sci-fi setting in which players are in control of a colony and have to manage and expand it while facing different crisis and invaders. M.I.N.D can be played solo or in two players, but also with up to four players with the help of an extra copy. The goal is to build your colony and complete the set of five achievements required by the game before the last turn ends and players can do this by cooperating or competing one with each other.

Players build new sectors, train new citizens and manage their command to do as many actions as they can to maximize production of credits, influence, equipment or overpower while also progressing. The game requires lots of planning since there are many things that can intervene and ruin your plan if not paying attention. Players interact and can either help or sabotage each other. Units can be sent to start fires, break structures, close doors, start an epidemic or even unpower structures. To resolve all these players need to assign command to their units and use them to repair, build or interact with different things from the colony. Players can improve their units by equipping them with items or assigning them influence thus enabling them access to the faction's unique super power.

If you like strategy games, games that can be played solo, games that have confrontation or simply that let you cooperate with a friend while facing a great challenge then M.I.N.D may be the perfect choice for you.
161276.name: MIND

161278.name: Spiritual Warfare
161278.description:
Spiritual Warfare is everything you want in a game! It is strategic, engaging, innovative and offers players the chance to use a different strategy EVERY TIME they play. Acquire Spirit Points to win! Defend yourself with the help of Angels! Demolish your opponents with twelve different Demons.

Each player starts the game with an equal number of Character Cards, 4 Orb Cards, 1 Angel and 1 Demon. The board is set with 5 Orb Cards to draw from, and the rest of the Orb Cards are placed to the left of the pool. There are Black, Red, Blue White, Green and WILD Orb Cards. Black & Red Orbs can be used to purchase Demons. Blue & White Orbs can be used to purchase Angels. Green Orbs are used to by Action Cards, and a combination of all 5 colors gets you a Gate Key.

On a players turn, they may choose to do one of the following actions: 1) pulling Orb Cards 2) spend Orb Cards 3) Attack a player

You obtain Spirit Points by: Purchasing Angels and Demons, going through Gates using Gate Keys and White Orbs, buying Action Cards (some of them are just Spirit Points), or Battling other players!

In a battle, the attacking player uses their Demon Cards and the defending player uses their Angel Cards. Each player starts with 10 hit points. Players take turns rolling dice to try and damage the other player. 5's and 6's are hits wile 1-4 miss. Angel and Demon Cards consist of either Battle Cards that last for the entire battle (i.e. Armored Angel - You cannot be hit by 5's) or Attack Cards that are played before a player rolls the dice (i.e. Fire Demon - On your next roll, 6'd hit for 2 damage). The first player to bring their opponent to zero Hit Points wins.

Finally, the Character Cards in the game all give slight advantages and manipulate all of the mechanics listed above!
Now...Bow your head, say your prayers, and prepare for Spiritual Warfare!

161279.description:
Promo expansion or Korrigans given away at the 5000 first visitors of "Paris est Ludique" in June 2014.

Place the Orange Korrigan in the village. The player that have the bag can move it to the neighbouring field and look at the clover tokens.

The Orange Korrigan exists in 10 different flavors, corresponding to the 10 Korrigans from the base game (but colored orange).
161279.name: Korrigans: Paris est Ludique Promo

161280.name: Crosscountry Canada 2
161280.description:
Crosscountry Canada 2 is an educational simulation software program for children ages 9–13 (grade four through grade eight).

Players drive an 18 wheeler truck picking up and delivering commodities across Canada while learning about provinces, cities, territories and more. Making wise decisions along the way will result in a successful trip.

Source: Wikipedia, "Crosscountry Canada 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

161281.name: Crosscountry USA 2
161281.description:
If you liked the original Crosscountry USA, you and your students will love this new, updated version of the program.

Your geography classroom becomes a real American adventure!

Students 'drive' an 18-wheel truck around the country picking up and delivering a variety of commodities. As they travel between any of 203 cities, they'll learn valuable skills including problem solving, map reading and decision making. On-screen maps, GPS navigation and a compass allow students to learn directions and plan the most efficient route. Students learn time management, decide when to eat and sleep, and watch road conditions.

Photographs of cities, famous places, and landmarks add a visual dimension to the journey.

Source: The Publisher's Website.

161282.name: Crosscountry Canada Photo Safari
161282.description:
Start your engines and set off on a photo safari!

Children embark on a fascinating mission to find and photograph Canadian species at risk.

This simulation lets children drive a truck through every province and territory and up to 79 communities in search of animals.

Driving safely and staying healthy along the way is very important for a successful journey.

Vivid 3-D graphics create a real-life environment and make learning fun!

Source: The Publisher's Website.

161283.name: Crosscountry USA Photo Safari
161283.description:
Start your engines and set off on a photo safari!

Children embark on a fascinating mission to find and photograph North American endangered animals. This simulation lets children drive a truck through every state and more than 100 cities in search of animals. Drive safely and staying healthy along the way is very important for a successful journey.

Source: The Publisher Website.

161284.name: Sectors Twenty-Four & Twenty-Five
161284.description:
From publisher blurb:

The exploration of "Unexplored Space" continues with Sectors 24 & 25. You'll find a few colonies in this tome, but you'll also find lots of planets waiting to be explored, and planets that were once colonized, but no longer are.
There are more machine culture colonies that have been abandoned, and civilizations that have died, plus worlds that are screaming out to be explored, with dangers that characters can't even begin to imagine.

161285.name: Anonima Gidierre (Numero 2 - Estate 1995)
161285.description: Issue #2 of the Anonima Gidierre fanzine.

rpgissuearticle.120944: Clubs' News: le iniziative di gennaio-febbraio

161289.name: Would You Rather Picture Card Game
161289.description: A card-based version of the classic game. Form a custom "would you rather" question by pairing up two illustrated dilemma cards from your hand. Guess how your opponent will answer your custom question and, if you're right, you'll score a point. The first player to five points wins.

161290.description:
GAME OVERVIEW
Space Movers is a cooperative sci-fi adventure set in the year 2201. In this game you play the role of one of the crew members on board the space ship Liberty. Your job as a Mover is to jump from planet to planet in the system picking up and delivering cargo. Movers specialize in getting cargo to its destination as efficiently as possible. As you deliver cargo, you are rewarded with resources that are needed to keep the Liberty flying. But you must do this without drawing too much attention from the Universal Oversight.

Universal Oversight (UO) is the government elected by the planets to police the system. The UO watches all movement through the system in an attempt to keep order. Over time it has become corrupt and evil. UO Scouts are sometimes dispatched to chase down and interrogate Movers that have been spotted delivering cargo. They are looking to confiscate anything that might be a threat to the UO’s power. If you draw the eye of the UO too often, your job will eventually become impossible. You and your fellow players must work together to deliver cargo, avoid UO Scouts and quickly handle any Events that pop up along the way.

To win the game, you need to complete a set of five Objective Cards. These cards directly continue the story that begins in the included graphic novel Finding Liberty. (A 20-card random objective card deck will also be included with the game. Players can choose 5 cards from this deck for a fresh experience each game)

- Unique Dice-Rolling Mechanic
How the dice are rolled-Space Movers handles dice-rolling to complete skill checks in a whole new way. Rolls take place inside the game box on a specially designed roll board. Dice are rolled one at a time instead of all at once. For each skill needed in the check, 1 die will be rolled needing a 5 or higher for success. Since the dice are rolled 1 at a time into the box, players are encouraged to strike dice already rolled in an attempt to change the result as needed. After all the dice are rolled, one last roll is made using the blank 6 sided die. This signals the end of the skill check and is a player’s last attempt to change any previous die results.

- Comic Book Included
The story begins in the Comic book “Finding Liberty” that will be included with the game. Objective cards that match the Comic continue the story as you play the game.

- Game Soundtrack
Listen to the official game soundtrack on your computer or smart phone.
161290.name: Space Movers 2201

161291.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Green Dragon Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens, and includes Campaign Adventure #3.1: The Green Queen's Demesne.
161291.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Green Dragon Expansion Pack

161292.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Sun Elf Wizard Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens, and includes Campaign Adventure #3.3: The Toll of the Dread Alarum.
161292.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Sun Elf Wizard Expansion Pack

161293.name: Shining Resonance
161293.description:
User Summary

Shining Resonance features party members who use musical instruments as weapons. Instruments used during battle it will give a similar feeling to hearing a band perform. Irvan, who is one of the last remaining dragons is searching for the maiden who treated his wounds when he was younger. It is said that when he does a miracle will occur but the imperial army, church forces, and dragon slayers aim to capture Irvan to obtain his power.

161294.description:
Includes 14 tiles which allow the civilization to speed up its growth, but they work only for a short period.

This expansion will never be available in retail, it will be available only by Kickstarting the project. Backers received a little baggie separate from the game box, with the tiles and instruction sheet.

The instructions gave the names as follows:

- The Golden Era Expansion (English)
- Historia Erweiterung Spielregein (German)
- L'Espansione Golden Era (Italian)
- L'Extension Golden Era (French)
161294.name: Historia: Golden Era

161295.description:
Includes 16 tiles which offer special bonus to the first Civilization which reach it.

Backers received the tiles. The rules are in the game's rulebook. Not a Kickstarter exclusive; if still available, players can buy them from game shops.
161295.name: Historia: Civilization Goals

161296.description:
Includes 7 tiles, one for each civilization, which allow the players to modify their actions.

Backers received the tiles. The rules are in the game's rulebook. Not a Kickstarter exclusive; if still available, players can buy them from game shops.
161296.name: Historia: The Ways of Command

161297.description:
In the near future of Paradox, a space-time disturbance called The Quake is fracturing entire worlds’ timelines and removing these worlds from existence. Two to four players take on the roles of scientists working quickly to repair these worlds’ connections to their past, present, and future by making new time strands — however, every repaired connection ripples through time and fuels the Quake to fracture more worlds. When the storm’s power fades, the most successful scientist will be hailed as a hero throughout the multiverse.

Paradox takes familiar board game elements such as card drafting, set collection, and resource management, then adds a Bejewelled-like grid of colorful disks for each player to manipulate, along with a universe of worlds that must be protected by game’s end. As a result, Paradox presents players with a unique experience that is simple to learn yet challenging to master as players navigate three interlocking systems to protect these worlds from the chaotic forces of the Quake.

Paradox is designed by Brian Suhre and is illustrated by 15 artists, each with their unique view of one of the worlds. Paradox plays in about 20-30min per player.
161297.name: Paradox

161298.description:
This army box has a counter tray that helps to bring order to your collection.
It also contains:
3 new units (Recon Platoon, Sherman Platoon and Weapon Platoon)
High Command (Artillery, Smoke, Directives and more...)
3 new Heroes
15 wooden order tokens, 2 dice for the fourth Infantry Division.
161298.name: Heroes of Normandie: US Army Box

161299.description:
Contains:
3 new units (Panzergrenadiere, Sturmpioniere, Panzergruppe)
High Command (Artillery, Airstrike, Smoke, Directives and more...)
2 new Heroes
15 wooden order tokens and 2 dice for the Panzer-Lehr-Division
161299.name: Heroes of Normandie: German Army Box

161300.name: Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Desert Ruins
161300.description:
From the back of the pack:

24" x 30" mat
1" squares on each side

SCORCHING SANDS!

Whether your party is searching for a lost pyramid or fighting to survive in the harsh desert sun, no Game Master wants to interrupt the adventure to draw every single sand dune and fallen obelisk. Fortunately, with Paizo Publishing's latest Pathfinder Flip-Mat, you don't have to! This line of gaming maps provides ready-to-use and captivatingly detailed fantasy set pieces for the busy Game Master. Whether you need a site to unearth buried secrets or battle deadly scorpions, this double-sided combat mat makes the perfect setting!

Don't waste your time sketching when you could be playing. With Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Desert Ruins, you'll be ready next time your players brave the desert sun!

161301.name: The King's Highway
161301.description:
In order to improve trade, quality of life, and his militia’s ability to quickly respond to threats, the king has commissioned you and your team to complete highways between the towns and villages throughout his Kingdom.

The king’s highway will be constructed with dice having highway segments on their faces. Players work from a communal pool of dice and take turns placing sections of the road to earn prestige. Of course, whoever completes the highway earns a boost of prestige. Be careful, though, completing the highway before all of its paths are finished will cause you to lose points.

Because the king is too busy to pay attention to who did the actual work, whoever has the most prestige at the end of the project is given the credit, the glory, and the money!

161302.name: Ender Dungeon's Last Crawl
161302.description:
Ender Dungeon's Last Crawl is a light game with simple mechanics meant for casual gamers or even as a gateway game. Players each become 1 of 3 heroes sent by the king to exact revenge upon the local terror, Ender Dungeon.

You and your friends will delve deep into Ender’s caves by rolling dice and slaying wave after wave of the boss’ ferocious minions. After 45 to 60 minutes of fierce battle, the surviving heroes will finally come face-to-paper-face with Ender Dungeon himself.

Can you slay the fiend and save the kingdom?

This is a light game with very light mechanics. Players fight against progressively more difficult monster decks. Fighting takes place by rolling dice in an attempt to roll higher than the monsters.

161303.name: Top Deck
161303.description:
A game of guessing, bluffing, and betting to out-wit your opponents and collect the most points.

Comes with everything you need for 2 - 6 players. You can play a couple of matches for 15 – 20 minutes of fun, or spend up to an hour playing a full game. Top Deck is designed so that inexperienced gamers can rely on dumb-luck to get by, but experienced gamers can develop specific strategies in hopes of out-thinking other players.

You will each use a personal themed deck, Bonus cards, and character abilities to compete for individual Slots. The highest bidder wins, but each slot has an increasing value, so the stakes get higher as the game goes on.

161304.name: Koukai Sarena Katta Shuki - The Note
161304.description:
User Summary

A 1st-person horror action adventure game released in Japan and Europe.

161305.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Frost Giant Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens, and includes Campaign Adventure #3.4: Big Game Hunting.
161305.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Frost Giant Expansion Pack

161306.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Sun Elf Guard Troop Expansion Pack includes six pre-painted miniatures and numerous upgrade cards and tokens, and includes Campaign Adventure #3.7: Behind Enemy Lines.
161306.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Sun Elf Troop Expansion Pack

161307.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Hobgoblin Troop Expansion Pack includes six pre-painted miniatures and numerous upgrade cards and tokens, and includes Campaign Adventure #3.6: An Uphill Battle.
161307.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Hobgoblin Troop Expansion Pack

161308.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Dwarven Ballista Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens, and includes Campaign Adventure #3.5: Protect the Prototype.
161308.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Dwarven Ballista Expansion Pack

161309.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Wraith Expansion Pack includes two pre-painted miniatures and numerous upgrade cards and tokens, and includes Campaign Adventure #3.2: The Barony Below.
161309.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Wraith Expansion Pack

161310.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Black Shadow Dragon Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens, and includes Campaign Adventure #4.2: A Night of Shadows.
161310.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Black Shadow Dragon Expansion Pack

161311.name: The Pirate
161311.description:
From publisher blurb:

The smell of the sea and the wind in your face, the freedom to go where you want and take what you can: that’s what being a pirate is all about. Unfortunately, the stories of legendary pirates and buried treasure fail to mention all of the old, dry food, watered-down ale, harsh environments, and ferocious monsters.

Yeah, it is not the life for everyone, but some are drawn to the tales and thrill and others never really had a choice. The law won’t care one way or another, so grab a cutlass and load your flintlock. Will you carve our your own name in the annals of history, or will you be just another rotting corpse dangling from the gallows.

Set sail to find out.

This product is two separate pdf files.

The first is a digest-sized, 19 page book laid out like the Dungeon World rulebook. It contains...

The pirate! (Obviously.) Turn the environment against your enemies, venture to islands in search of treasure, then celebrate by blowing it all at the nearest port.
New equipment like the flintlock pistol, blunderbuss, grenades, flask of grog, and sharkskin armor.
Eight new magic items: immolate your enemies with the dragonfire blunderbuss, or fold up your ship and carry it around with you!
Two compendium classes: the dread pirate and sea-shackled. Use your fearsome reputation to dominate the high seas, or swear allegiance to Davy Jones at the cost of your humanity.
A kind of behind the scenes look at some of the fiction and other content.




The other is a 2-page, letter-sized character sheet for you to print out and actually use. As with our other playbooks, custom graphics abound.

161312.name: Gordo the Clown (Supers! Revised)
161312.description:
From publisher blurb:

Justice Wheels 3 for SUPERS! (Revised Edition) features Gordo, a super-powered Magical Multiplying Mountebank of Malfeasance.

This pdf contains stats, background and art for Gordo and his custom clown car.

But that's not all! Since SUPERS! now has both vehicle combat and miniature rules - this pdf comes with nifty paper miniatures of both Gordo and his car.

161313.name: Deadeye
161313.description:
From publisher blurb:

DEADEYE!

An assassin-for-hire, Deadeye has an arrow with your hero's name on it! Raised with a bow in his hand, he's got a trick arrow for almost any situation.

rpgseries.24276: R.E.A.C.T.: Research, Engineering, And Crisis Team

161314.name: Bughunt
161314.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new form of lethal illicit drug is slowly infiltrating the city streets, causing rampant death and overdose. From the shadows, the family of a deceased young woman cry out for vengeance. To help them the players must battle lunatic cyborgs, viscous thugs, and gangs galore. This quick adventure will have your players racing all over town, pursuing the elusive source.

Is this gonna be a standup fight, sir, or another bughunt?

Bughunt Contains:

Character Portrait Stand-Ups to show your players all the major NPCs
Three 1" square maps (20 pages total)
24 Car-Chase Challenge Cards
8 pages of optional Chase expansion rules
24 Clue Cards to hand out random clues to the players as they investigate
Suitable as a stand-alone adventure or can be incorporated into a sci-fi campaign.

161315.name: Ravine
161315.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 32 x 30 inch, full color battlemap of a Ravine with a rope bridge.

The Product comes with the Square, Hex and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps.

The Ravine is a single external map depicting a rickety bridge suspended over a raging river tethered to two old trees. An impressive waterfall towers above the bridge to the east.

The Ravine is intended for use in fantasy or modern games, although Game Masters could find good use for it with other genres as well.

Adventure hook.
Out of the Frying Pan and into the Cold: The group flees across the mountain path as hordes of enemies chase after them. Will they make a desperate last stand on the rickety rope bridge, or perhaps they will try to cut the ropes that tenuously theaters the bridge to a gnarly old tree, sending scores of pursuers to their death. Of course, the pursuers might have similar ideas, putting fire to the old ropes or boxing the group onto the bridge as reinforcements wait on the far side. Another possible complication could be the waterfall suddenly bursting with flashflood water, threatening to sweep the group into the raging ravine river. The waters are cold and the currents strong, making it a desperate swim to avoid crashing into the downstream rocks.

161316.description:
The fourth expansion for Heart of Crown. It requires either the base set or the Fairy Garden expansion to play.

This expansion adds a completely new type of card, Support Cards, which confer an extra bonus when nominating a Princess. A new Rare card is also introduced, Oasis City Nefertiri, which does not enter the market like normal. The set also introduces a new variety of Curse card.

Additionally, new rules are added for games with 8 or more Princesses available.

The set contains:

1 new Princess
16 new types of Common Card (5 of each type)
2 Revised versions of Common Cards from the Fairy Garden expansion, Guildmaster and Merchant Fleet (5 of each)
18 placeholder cards (1 for each Common Card type included)
8 Support Cards
20 Misfortune Cards
1 new Rare Card
161316.name: Heart of Crown: Six City Alliance

boardgamehonor.26780: 2014 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee

161317.description: Terra Mystica: Fire & Ice has the original factions brace themselves for new competitors: Yetis – the masters of power, Ice Maidens – who adore their Temples, Acolytes – whose entire life is focused on the cults, and Dragonlords – who use their power to create volcanoes. And as if this wasn't enough, there are two more factions, Shapeshifters and Riverwalkers, who ignore the most basic of rule of one faction, one terrain type. (Inconceivable to the Halflings!)
161317.name: Terra Mystica: Fire & Ice

boardgameaccessory.180724: Terra Mystica: Acrylic Overlay Set version 2

161318.name: 3Dimensional Chess
161318.description:
A two player game played on 3 standard chess boards arranged vertically one above the other. The "light" squares are transparent to help see what pieces are where. Each player starts with 16 pieces on each board in almost the same setup as standard chess.
There is only one king and he starts in the normal position on the centre board. Kings, Queens and Bishops move as normal but extended into 3 dimensions. Knights move as normal and stay on the board they started on. Pawns and rooks move as normal but can also move levels. There are five new pieces, Prince (which replaces king on top and bottom boards), Princess, Abbey, Cannon and Galley, each having there own special movement rules.
The object of the game is to take the king.

161319.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Movanic Deva Angel Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens, and includes Campaign Adventure #4.3: The Ever-Watchful Eyes.
161319.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Movanic Deva Angel Expansion Pack

161320.description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Aarakocra Troop Expansion Pack includes six pre-painted miniatures and numerous upgrade cards and tokens, and includes Campaign Adventure #4.1: The Howling Chasm.
161320.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Aarakocra Troop Expansion Pack

161321.name: Haven: Titan Command
161321.description:
Haven: Titan Command is a 2-4 player sci-fi strategy card game set in an new and exciting galaxy where each player takes command of a hulking futuristic battle Titan. There are four rivalling factions currently at war, and each player must choose their allegiance, construct a deck and then charge into battle to claim victory for their faction.

The Core Set features over 190 cards, allowing players to build their own decks using a combination of faction and neutral cards to fully customise their Titan build. Each Titan build must carefully balance its reliance on combat equipment armed and activated during the fight, pilot manoeuvres which are activated as surprise actions to evade or ambush, and field skills which provide support from other battlefield units.

Players battle it out over a number of rounds until only one Titan is left standing victorious.

161322.name: La gran carrera: Car-chís
161322.description:
Simple Formula 1 race game.

It's the only one game published by "El taller del ocio", a little spanish publisher.

The player attempts to complete the circuit, overcoming obstacles in race, trying to make your team add more points than opponents or come first.

It is a game of rolling dice and move forward with some obstacles and a penalty die.

161323.description:
Alternate-art starting deck for the Ascension Deck Building Game family.

Contains:
8 Zombie Apprentice
2 Zombie Militia
161323.name: Ascension: Zombie Starting Deck

161324.name: Druglord
161324.description:
Druglord is a thematic war-game based on the history of Cartel's wars, with a strong commitment pro-legalization.

4-6 Players will impersonate and control the most powerful and dangerous Cartels in the world: Mafia, Yakuza, Triads, the Cartel of Medellín, the National Crime Syndicate and the Bratva (Russian Mafia). They'll have to distribute their forces all over the world, conquer the production places of drugs (for example: Colombia or Afghanistan) and the markets (cities like Los Angeles, Amsterdam or Tokio), organizing the flow of 4 kinds of substances that have different perks. This way players will gain soldiers that can be used to attack or defend; cooperation is acceptable, regulated and sometimes very useful. There are also cards to be drawn at each turn, inspired by historical or fictitious events related to the criminal world. They can have good or bad effects, and often there are choices to be made.

The goal is known at the beginning of the game, when each player draws a goal card (all different but balanced) that has to remain secret until the conditions of victory are fulfilled. There's also a semi-randomized countdown towards legalization: an event that in our point of view (and according to the ideas of many economists) would terminate the business of Cartels. When this happens (after 2-3 hours, according to the players' choices) the game is over and victory is assigned by points.

161325.name: The Haunted Tunnels
161325.description:
From publisher blurb:

Play As A Kobold!

Ever wondered what it’s like from the kobold’s side of the game table? Here’s your chance to find out! The Kobolds of Tzarker Mines live a gloomy existance deep in the mountains mining treasure for a volcano dragon. When disaster strikes, can you save your tribe from a fiery doom?

Part 1 of a 3-part adventure, this module can be run as a stand-alone adventure, or as the first part of The Kobolds of Tzarker Mines. After playing this adventure, the characters can continue their koboldy shenanigans in The Kobolds of Tzarker Mines Part 2: The Lair of the Trapmaster.

This Pathfinder compatible product is designed for four level 1 kobold characters, and will bring them to level 2 if they survive to the end of their adventures.

161326.name: The Lair of the Trapmaster
161326.description:
From publisher blurb:

Play As A Kobold!

Ever wondered what it’s like from the kobold’s side of the game table? Here’s your chance to find out! The Kobolds of Tzarker Mines live a gloomy existance deep in the mountains mining treasure for a volcano dragon. When disaster strikes, can you save your tribe from a fiery doom?

Part 2 of a 3-part adventure, this module can be run as a stand-alone adventure, or as the second part of The Kobolds of Tzarker Mines. After playing this adventure, the characters can continue their koboldy shenanigans in The Kobolds of Tzarker Mines Part 3: Fury of the Dragon.

This Pathfinder compatible product is designed for four level 2 kobold characters.

161327.name: Fury of the Dragon
161327.description:
From publisher blurb:

Play As A Kobold!

Ever wondered what it’s like from the kobold’s side of the game table? Here’s your chance to find out! The Kobolds of Tzarker Mines live a gloomy existance deep in the mountains mining treasure for a volcano dragon. When disaster strikes, can you save your tribe from a fiery doom?

This Pathfinder compatible product is designed for four level 2 kobold characters, and will bring them to level 3 if they survive to the end of their adventures.

161328.name: Minor Artifact: Book of Eight Restful Retreats
161328.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every so often, a group of adventurers stumbles upon the Book of Eight Restful Retreats and discovers, much to their delight, that the pages are in fact doorways to idyllic demiplanes complete with lodging, food, and servants to soothe the battered and footsore adventurer. From rustic woodland camps to balmy tropical island resorts, each retreat contains unique relaxation and recreation opportunities.
Nothing good lasts forever, though, and parties who overstay their welcome find that not everything in the book is sunshine and roses. Good fun for players and GM alike, the Book of Eight Restful Retreats offers plenty of opportunities for adventure, mischief, and mayhem.
The Book of Eight Restful Retreats is a detailed description of a minor artifact, complete with:

A beautifully comprehensive yet easily understood rule set for operation of the book and the functioning of the demiplanes
Detailed planar traits per Pathfinder rules
Eight thoroughly described retreats, each with a unique environment, shelter, food, and means of relaxation
One original monster, so PCs don’t decide to permanently retire inside the book
Loads of ideas for creative players and GMs

161329.name: Age of Strategy
161329.description:
User Summary of game:
A turn based strategy game that involves no luck, all combat and movement have set parameters and ratings.
A good variety of troops and buildings, with various upgrades available in the tech tree. This enables you to style your army in certain areas creating greater variety between players.

161330.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other (fancy) elements of Juicy Couture, a brand name.
161330.name: Monopoly: Juicy Couture

161331.description:
This promo card is given as a reward for participating on Organized play.

Fire Elemental

Creature
Cost 20 Mana
Health 15
Armor 0

Quick Attack (Claws of Fire): Melee, 5 Dice Defrost
(Scorching Heat) 2 Dice Unavoidable

Upkeep +1 Hydro +2 Incorporeal Nonliving Flame Inmunity

Hydro attacks gain the Ethereal trait against Fire Elemental
161331.name: Mage Wars: Fire Elemental Promo Card

161332.description:
This promo card is given as a reward for participating on Organized play

Bloodwave Greatbow

Creature
Cost 12 Mana
Health 11
Armor 0
Defense 9+

Quick Attack (Dagger): Melee, 2 Dice

Full Attack (Greatbow): Ranged 1-2, 4 Dice

When Bloodwave Greatbow is affected by a friendly command spell, his Greatbow attack gains +2 until the end of the round.
161332.name: Mage Wars: Bloodwave Greatbow Promo Card

161333.description:
This promo card is given as a reward for participating on Organized Play.

Spiked Armor

Equipment

Cost 9 Mana

Mage gains the Lighting +1 trait, a Damage Barrier, and armor +2.

Armor +2
161333.name: Mage Wars: Spiked Armor Promo Card

161334.description:
This promo card is given as a reward for participating on Organized play.

Raincloud

Conjuration - Cloud, Weather

Cost 8 Mana
Health 5

Incorporeal. Flying. Hydro Inmunity.

All objects in Raincloud´s zone gains the Flame -2, Acid -2 and regenerate 1 traits. Each Upkeep phase you may remove 1 Burn condition or 1 Corrode condition, from 1 object in Raincloud´s zone, by paying its removal cost. Once per round, immediatly before or after any friendly Action Phase, you may pay 1 mana to move Raincloud 1 zone and attach it to taht zone.
161334.name: Mage Wars: Raincloud Promo Card

161335.name: Hit It! Tactical Card Game of Tennis
161335.description:
Hit It! is a quick print & play card game of tennis for two players.

Each player has a deck of 25 cards, of three types to represent different tennis shots, plus two types of cards that modify shots. Each player sets out four cards face down to form the playing surface. (Choosing these cards adds an element of deck building to the game.) Each player takes six of the remaining cards from their deck. The first player "serves" by placing a card on one of the opponent's hitting zones and draws a replacement card from his deck. The opponent then moves his player marker to the ball and selects what card he will use to hit the ball back. This continues until one player manages to place a fourth card in a particular hitting zone, or a player is unable to return the ball.

Play continues until one player has won the set, i.e. six games.

Hit It! has abstracted tennis into a quick tactical card game, but retains the feel of the sport.

161336.name: Jungle Heart
161336.description:
The long, lost island of Jungle Heart has just been discovered. What mysteries lie beneath its shadowy canopies?

Monstrous animals!

Vicious tribes!

Malicious militants!

Deadly traps and hazards!

Ghosts and demons!

Yet beyond all of these obstacles lies crumbling temples brimming with gold, jewels, and priceless relics.

In Jungle Heart, you and your opponents take on the role of an investor in the 1940s, sending adventurers, scientists, big game hunters and other pulp standards to the jagged rock shores of Jungle Heart to find the clues necessary to tap into the unlimited wealth of the island.

Game play is simple:

1) Recruit and equip your adventuring party... then it's "off we go" to the island.

2) Use supply tokens to pay for actions while on the island.

3) When the supplies run dry, your adventurers return to the mainland to regroup and reequip.

4) Play a victory card to earn points.

Jungle Heart is the second game in development from Wine Key Games and is capable of bringing hours--nay! weeks of indepth play.

Are you prepared to visit Jungle Heart?

161337.name: Of Mushroom Men
161337.description:
From publisher description:

What's better than mushroom people? I'll tell you what, highly toxic, telepathic mushroom people!

Of Mushroom Men presents an all-new subterranean mushroom people race, The Agarid!

Inside you will find:


The agarid monster race, with 2 feats for enhanced telepathy.
2 pre-constructed agarid NPCs: the selfless Agarid Guard, and the self-serving Aragrid Mage
The Agarid Worker: the workhorse of the agarid colony, with rules for using mining tools as weapons.
The Agarid Mauler: the 8-foot-tall enforcer of the agarid defense forces.
The Agarid Spore Queen: the poisonous spore spewing ruler of the agarid.
The Agarid Juggernaut: unstoppable monster of mushroom might!


All the mushroom people you could even need, with CRs ranging from 1/2 to 10.

161338.name: Zack Zero
161338.description:
User Summary

This platformer follows Zack Zero as he tries to rescue his beloved from kidnappers who want to exchange her for a mineral that Zack has found in outer space. Zack can change between four suits: regular jet pack, fire, ice, and stone -- each with its own abilities to guide him past regular foes and bosses as well as navigate platform screens. Besides well drawn comic cut scenes, this game had notably good lush comic-style graphics.

161339.name: Action Waterloo
161339.description:
A two player game played on an 18x24 board. Players each place two 2x6"mountains" on the board and then each place 54 soldiers(25mm plastic figures) on the 3 rows nearest them. Each player secretly selects a restricted set of 5 squares on his opponents rear row.
The winner is the first player to get his own soldiers on all five of these squares.
On his turn a plyer takes a card and follows its instructions. He then rolls two dice, one die number represents the number of units he will move and the other die represnts the number of squares units move. He then moves his units and executes capture by replacement, some decided by die roll.
As far as I can tell all the "Action" A-Toys are the same game on the same board but with different figures.

161340.name: Ergo
161340.description:
From the introduction

Ergo is a different direction in the way role-playing games are played. It changes the fundamental make up of a role-playing game by making one simple change.
